review.title: Great for quick overnight
review.reviewText: This hotel was great for a quick overnight stay before flying home.  Close to the airport, however with there being a lot of construction on the roads between the airport and the hotel, the shuttle was not running on schedule.  We were relying on the shuttle to get us to the airport on time, and there was no communication from any of the staff that the shuttle would be running late.  After waiting almost an hour for the shuttle, the driver came flying into the parking lot and almost ran over the crowd that was waiting.  We barely made it to the airport on time, and the driver scraped a barricade at the terminal.  I can't give the hotel itself a bad review, because the rooms were clean and comfortable for what it was, but the shuttle experience was an awful end to our trip.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle service

review.reviewText:
The main reason that I'm not giving this hotel a better rating is that I had a bad experience with the shuttle service to and from the airport. The shuttle to crowns plaza sfo skipped out stop, even as we chased after the bus. My girlfriend and I waited over an hour for that same shuttle to finally pick us up. When we called the front desk, they once said the shuttle would be arriving in less than 20 minutes. 30 minutes later, we called again and they said that the shuttle was at the terminal right before our stop. Other shuttle drivers who had made circles around the shuttle circuit offered to give us a ride "if we gave them something on the side". I wasn't happy about that treatment either. 

The shuttle driver arrived 30 minutes after that call. When I informed the concierge about the experience, she just said she'd let the manager know. 

I know it's awful to knock points of the rating for a hotel based on the service of a complimentary shuttle, but over the week we were there, we'd become pretty familiar with the drivers (who, it turns out, all drive for other hotels, same company I guess). Transportation to the hotel was simply too inconsistent, and I was left with the feeling that if the driver's weren't incentivized, there was little they were willing to do to help us out.

We hope you will give us another chance after our renovations.

There is road construction going on in front of the hotel, which adds terrible dust. If it is not close to where we like to go to eat, we wouldn't have booked it.

review.title: Not worth $400 a night
review.reviewText:
The hotel does show a little bit of age, but is till in pretty good shape.
 I went to the restaurant for dinner and ordered a beer , water, hamburger with cheese and bacon, garlic fries and a side salad. I had to wait for my drinks and had to re ask for a water. Hamburger came with cheese and no bacon. It was served with regular fries, so I asked for garlic fries. The waitress was happy to change out, but when she brought my plate back the garlic fries were cold and I wasn't about to ask for hot ones in fear of what might be done to the rest of my meal.
I then returned to my room and filled out the form for breakfast in my room to hang from my room door. I ordered coffee, orange juice and granola with milk and bananas. They came earlier then I requested (thank goodness I got up early) no orange juice and no bananas. I then called room service and let the phone ring about 30 times and hung up. I tried again about 10 minutes later, same thing. They did call me back and I did eventually get my bananas, but still no juice.
The employees are very nice and do apologize when the do make a mistake.
Silicon valley has become such a business orientated area the rooms are almost impossible to get unless you reserve like a month ahead of time. This was one of the only hotels I could reserve last minute, but I truly don't understand how they can charge $400 a room.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed and they did waive the $20 parking fee they charge to park in their own parking lot.

review.title: Excellent business hotel for a good sleep
review.reviewText: The Crowne Plaza by SFO is an excellent hotel for a good sleep before or after a flight. I frequently fly in and out of SFO and try and avoid flying in or out at night but sometimes I have to stay at the airport. The Crowne Plaza is best bang for the buck for a good sleep by the airport. It's extremely close and has a shuttle that runs every 20 mins from 4am onward, early enough to even catch the earliest flights out of SFO. The breakfast is good and well priced (I've never eaten lunch or dinner here), staff is very friendly and the rooms are super comfortable. Spent two nights there last week (in and out) and was happy both times!

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText:
Van service was good, as was checking in. The clerk told us our room number which was not the number on the key. Consequently we were trying to open someone else's room in the middle of the night. 
The room itself was ok, bed was comfortable. It was very loud. The heater made noise all night. The dumpsters were right outside our window and we're emptied very early in the morning. 
It was not worth the money.

review.title: Stay just OK
review.reviewText: Stored our bags for early arrival.  Staff couldn't find bags for over 30 minutes.  Stored in secondary room. Our room was OK, but there was a dripping sound all night.  Couldn't sleep due to sound. Hotel convenient to airport, best part of stay.  Order the pizza in the restaurant.  Cheap and very good.

review.title: Good enough for the price when stranded at SFO
review.reviewText: Only stayed one night and picked this because of the price and the restaurant. Have stayed at the Aloft before but it doesn't have a real restaurant for meals.
review.positiveRemarks: The price and the restaurant. Good dinner and great breakfast buffet ($15). And the bed was comfy, bath was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Freeway noise was very loud from room 901, which is in the corner closest to the freeway. Had I know this I would have requested a different room.

review.title: Nice hotel near San Mateo events center
review.reviewText: Comfortable but my husband thought the bed was hard and he didn't sleep well.

review.title: NIce Hotel poor front desk services
review.reviewText: Upon checking in late at night front desk told me they did not have my reservation. I told them I made reservation late in the day thru Expedia and it may have not gotten to their computer. Staff was very unhelpful. I asked if it could have been faxed or on another list. They didn't bother to check. Had to go to my car to get my confirmation. Came back to stand in a 20 minute line only to be dismissed by another hotel clerk who stated reservation was not in system. Waited in line again and this staff found my reservation on the fax machine. The front desk staff was rude and dismissive and should know how to do their job.
review.negativeRemarks: hotel front desk staff be more helpful.

review.title: out of the way
review.reviewText: I did enjoy my stay and was very comfortable. The meeting I attended was well cared for as well.
review.locationRemarks: would like to have seen a few more close by activities, shops, stores, restaurants.

review.title: Courteous hotel staff
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay here, it was a great time, the staff are perfessional and very helpful. Room was clean and view was great.

review.title: stayed here before
review.reviewText: Clean little off path but ok - had to pay for parking daily maid didn't leave enough supplies

review.title: Needs a Complete Overhaul
review.reviewText: Don't book through Expedia, the room was horrible and the hotel would have given us a discount or refund but since it was through Expedia they couldn't. Expedia wouldn't do anything stating the hotel had to, etc.

review.title: Nice hotel close to both San Francisco and San Jos
review.reviewText: Very Friendly staff and room readiness. Easy to access from highway 101.

review.title: The staff made the difference! Treated us like VIP
review.reviewText: Just returned from the Crown Plaza SFO airport hotel. The staff were warm, welcoming and always ready to do what they  could to make our stay very nice. Nice selection of wine, and good food in the restaurant. Although the facility is showing it's age,  it was very clean. I would stay here again because of the staff alone!

review.title: Helpful staff
review.reviewText: The Rooms were small but comfortable, bed excellent, staff helped us get car rental returned, shuttle to SFA, informative driver, quick and reliable. - Only there a short time to get shut eye before flight and it served it's purpose.

review.title: Clean and friendly
review.reviewText: Went to the city to celebrate a friend birthday. After a long day in San Francisco, we drove to the hotel. The hotel was easy to find, a little tricky to get to but the friendly staff made up for it. The restaurant was excellent!! The servers and the food were just great. Very attentive and coming to our table, removing empty plates promprtly and checkin on us during our meal. The room was very clean and nicely done.
review.positiveRemarks: It was very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that I can think of.
review.locationRemarks: There is construction around the hotel but it is very closed to the exit of the freeway. The restaurant inside the hotel has excellent service and foo

review.reviewText: We were quite comfortable, the room we were in definitely was showing its age!

Our stay in hotel was overall satisfactory but not great. Hotel cleanliness was better compared to hotel facility condition.

Staff were professional. As always parking fee sucked ($20/night)

review.title: I can't tell why you are still working on.
review.reviewText:
Construction going on. 
You should complete the remodel by replacing the doors. Or freshly painting them. 
Replace the carpet in the rooms. 

The work so far is looking good but I can't tell if you will go back and do these things. 

Activating getting parking. Move those Super Bowl cars to the back of the lot. 

The shuttle back to the hotel from airport took at least an hour!  Horrible.

review.title: Things are beginning to fall apart
review.reviewText: It looks like a nice hotel, but it is getting old and needs attention from corporate management. The bathroom tiles are chipped. There are holes in the walls from previous mounted hair dryers. The beds, although comfortable, sag at the edges. My sister and son had no trouble with the shower, but I couldn't get hot water for my shower worth my life! The front desk is courteous and intelligent, but they are stressed out. The hotel help is not intelligent and the front desk personnel were trying so many times to get them to understand what to do.  Try not to park at the hotel as it is $20/night.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport. Very frequent bus to the hotel (Although I did not take the bus)
review.negativeRemarks: General facilities

review.title: Excellent customer service
review.reviewText: I love their customer service . Always willing to serve you better .

review.title: A hotel near to the airport
review.reviewText: Very convenient if you have a car, the hotel is on the highway exit. The room was comfortable and clean. At the rates you have to add the $20 daily parking charge!

review.title: All enclusive (UNENCLUSIVE)
review.reviewText: The sore thumb for me and for almost every on was the additional payment for parking. If I had known that I would have to pay $20.00 per day to park my car I would not have chosen this place. Overall the hotel was just ok. Expensive for what you get and the amenities. I would rate them a two (2). Expedia your every generous with the points you've given this hotel. I wish you were as generous to your customers

2 star hotel. Not up to standard. Was looking forward to staying at a 4 star hotel. I guess you get what you pay for. Wouldn't stay there again. You also have to pay $20 a day for parking. You are better off paying $30 more and staying at a nicer hotel with free parking.

review.title: rooms were not well cleaned and maintained
review.reviewText:
The first room we checked in was not cleaned. There were coffee or tea spots sticked on the tables. The room lock was broken that it could not be locked from inside. We requested a room change.

The staff delivered the key to the room next door for us. When asked why a hotel like Crowne maintained such a poor quality of room cleanness. His answer stroke me down. He said it's probably because we booked the hotel at the lowest rate that we were assigned to a room of this level. As far as he knew, there are rooms of 300 dollars a night that would offer better quality.
review.negativeRemarks: room cleanness and maintainence. staff attitudes
review.locationRemarks: The fitness room was good but some of the instruments were out of order

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: Very clean hotel and comfortable. Staff is very nice.

review.title: Nice hotel but they need to detail the room better
review.reviewText:
Got to the Hotel very early in the morning as weather was causing havoc with travel to SF from Denver. Only one person behind counter and he handled himself well. Got checked in and had to pay extra for parking. $20 a day. That should have been stated when making the reservations. I mean where do they expect you to park? Seems like a way to get more money from you. 
The room was in good order. Except there was a wad of chewing gum on the floor near the window that I didn't see so I stepped right into it of course.
So I spent some time cleaning expensive shoes. 
The snack or courtesy store was closed but the night attendant was gracious enough to open it and get what I needed after going through the gate at home.
review.positiveRemarks: It was fairly quiet being that it was so close to the air port. Restaurants were just a couple of miles down the road.
review.negativeRemarks: A slight upgrade to the beds would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: Down town SF is not too far and it is easy to get onto the 101. Lots of unique shops nearby.

review.title: Booked through Expedia
review.reviewText: Since it was booked through Expedia and prepaid, we were given the "booking service cheap room". Expedia was great, Crowne Plaza was not.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to the airport
review.reviewText:
I paid for self parking and the last night of my stay, got back late, and found no parking spaces available.  I had my disabled Mother in the car, and the front desk, apologized, refunded my parking charge and had valet take my car at no charge.

She offered me a glass of wine while I was waiting, which was really nice, but I refused.

Overall, the staff is excellent and the room was extremely comfortable.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Our room was so small there was no way a family of four could stay for three days comfortably. So we upgraded for an additional 30.00 a night. The new room had a giant table that took up half the room. We had to shove it clear in the corner so we could pull out the sleeper sofa for the kids. We still had to squeeze between table and sofa bed to get to bathroom and door. So much for a suit.The first night we were woke up at 3:30am. The room two doors down had a fire. We exited and everyone one was ok, thankfully! The staff proceeded to tell everyone that there was no fire. Someone was playing with the fire extinguisher. However, when we came out of our room we were choking on smoke, and we didn't have a fire extinguisher in our room so not sure where they got it. Would have been nice if they were just honest, things happen. Upon check out, the front desk gentleman was to busy talking on a radio to even ask how are stay was, or even a thank you. Not very impressed at all!!!
Nice, affordable hotel near the San Francisco International Airport. Perfect for short-term stays.

review.title: Time for an upgrade.
review.reviewText: Outdated decor, overpriced for the experience, bar and dining area left a lot to be desired.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to where we needed to be.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was much smaller than expected. Walking to room I didn't see one door that wasn't scuffed up. The carpet was worn out and dirty.

review.reviewText: Basic.  Parts of room were filthy like curtains...layers of dust and grime.  Very standard hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Airport
review.reviewText:
Nice and easy journey. Enjoy the stay.
Nice and easy journey. Enjoy the stay.
Nice and easy journey. Enjoy the stay.

review.title: GOOD news BAD news

Good Staff, Clean room, Bed OK, make sure if you do stay here that you insist on a room AWAY from the freeway. They will change your room if they have one available. But I turned off the TV at 9 and could not believe the level of noise through the windows.
Good breakfast-go for it when you book..
review.negativeRemarks: Board up the freeway side to block out the noise.
review.locationRemarks: Accessible to freeway

review.reviewText:
Excellent breakfast.
Close to airport.

review.title: A convenient and clean hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: We only stayed one night - staff were helpful and friendly - room was small but clean -  very convenient location for flying out of San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't know
review.locationRemarks: Close to San Francisco airport .... just stayed overnight.

review.title: Good location,
review.reviewText:
Staff was very good, good location 
Walls and rugs were a little too dirty in the hallways. 
Otherwise nice place to stay .

review.title: Needs a major remodel
review.reviewText: I wondered why the price was so reasonable.  This was only passable to stay, and I am surprised that it was in such bad condition for this level of a hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Uh - just bring it up to standards for a Crowne Plaza...

review.title: In need of renovation
review.reviewText: Great location and staff is nice. But the decor is outdated. Doors are dirty and scuffed up. The ice bucket teay was sticky, the glasses dirty. The a/c was so loud and rattled. Ordered room service and did not get one item a d was over charged on another. Overall, just disappointed, better hotels in the area for the same price.
Good for a business trip. Close to the airport. Fair restaurant.
You can tell that this is one of the older Crowne Plazas.
review.negativeRemarks: Renovations

review.reviewText: It was a good experience.  Would recommend. A little out dated but overall a good option.

review.title: decent airport hotel
review.reviewText: This was good for a tired airport hotel.  The rooms were a little dated but clean.   The hotel staff was polite and efficient.   They have a good shuttle service to airport.   request room away from highway.
review.locationRemarks: There is a good walking/jog track along the waters edge.

review.reviewText: Beds are very small and key from the room didnt work well!

review.title: Only good for business
review.reviewText: The hotel looks great from the outside but the rooms are mediocre at best. The TV in our room didn't even work and when we told the woman at the front desk she didn't do anything about it. For the price I paid it would have been wiser to just stay at the best western, it would have been cheaper and probably about the same room.

review.title: Nice quality hotel .
review.reviewText:
Booked this real late from airport .
Bus was right there to take us to hotel.
Check in lady was excellent .so helpful.
We were really late and she gave details of pizza delivery which took only about 20mins.

review.title: Friendly Front Desk Ladies
review.reviewText: Friendly staffs. Room is a little small and noisy from outside freeway traffic.

The breakfast was amazing. The wait staffs were super nice. The room was very nice. Make sure you ask for a room not next to the elevator. I could hear it all night long. Don't like the $20 a day parking fee. Overall a nice hotel.

review.title: Nice and easy to find it

review.title: Close to airport.. Decent prices

review.title: It was ok.
review.reviewText: Room is confortable. Closet and main door kinda old. The smell was not the best but aromatherapy helps.

review.title: Hotel away from San Francisco
review.reviewText: I stayed here to avoid the high prices in San Francisco. The first room we stayed in smelled so bad I had to request to be changed. In the new room the bathroom didn't lock, the beds in general were small for two people. I luckily only stayed two nights there.
Adequate.  Close to airport.  No bargain, but nothing else was either at this time of year.

review.title: Well located close to SFO and Freeways to SF.
review.reviewText: Pleasant staff and flexible. Pet friendly and comfortable room.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cleanliness, value compared to others near SFO

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The Crowne Plaza hotel is 10 minutes from the airport and 20 minutes with no traffic down town.  There aren't any restaurants  in walking distance of the hotel, but a mall with restaurants is about 10 minutes away. The hotel staff are very friendly and welcoming. They have a very nice restaurant and the food is great! there is a business center, gym, lounge and pool on premises all very nice and up-kept.  This hotel was a steal for its price.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Somewhat difficult to get into the parking lot due to major freeway exit construction.  The only rooms available for a family of 4 had 2 double beds.  Apparently there are no rooms with queen beds.  The air conditioning was very loud, and had to run all night in order to provide an appropriate room temperature.The pool and jacuzzi are very small, but in a pleasant room with a skylight.  Overall, a disappointing 2 days at this hotel.  And the hotel charges $20 per day for parking, with a room key operated gate that doesn't work very well.
review.positiveRemarks: Only a few miles from the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms with 2 queen beds.  New air conditioning.  Parking should be free.
review.locationRemarks: The old center of town is nearby, and is quite nice.

review.title: Easy freeway access and a convenient location
review.reviewText: Had two rooms for our family and stayed on the top floor with access to the executive lounge. The hotel's cafe has a movie theater sized screen...perfect for watching the Warrior games that led up to their victory in the Finals.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Having lost my wallet in a foreign town. The staff were very helpful and the attached restaurant and pub were great

review.positiveRemarks: Location, just off the highway and easy access.

review.title: Nice hotel near the airport.
review.reviewText: The biggest problem was that I waited for the shuttle at the airport for an hour when it's supposed to pick up every 20 minutes.  It was 11:00 at night.  Not a great welcome.  The room and restaurant were fine.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle driver

review.title: Abit run down.

review.title: Not worth your money
review.reviewText: I've stayed in several hotels and this one was overpriced for what they offer, charge you for parking and charge you for breakfast on top of that, location is not the greatest and I had a wonderful view to the lower restaurant roof sorry but not my choice of a hotel ever.

review.title: Did not receive the service I expected.
review.reviewText: Hotel was all I expected but the shuttle to the airport was a nightmare. I couldn't understand the driver and when I missed my stop I was told to walk the entire length of the airport. Since walking is a great difficulty for me I stayed in this hotel because of the shuttle service. I don't feel I got the service.
Parking for my guest is also charged. We cannot have meeting at the hotel without payment.

review.title: thankfully only one night

While bed and linens were clean and fine, draperies were visibly soiled. Roomed looked tired, needs paint.
The hotel is very good. Clean room and good service. It's close to the airport, and not far away from San Francisco.

review.title: Nice & Comfy, but Pricey!
review.reviewText: We had a mostly wonderful experience at this hotel. The front lobby staff was incredibly friendly and efficient! The room was super great. The bed and pillows were ooooh, so comfy! The bummer comes when we go to grab a quick breakfast at the cafe. We thought it was a lot like the hotel stays that we have in the midwest, but we were shocked at the expense of a buffet breakfast. We were told $11 and drinks included, but that did not happen. The menu and set-up is very confusing and deceiving, especially for someone who is trying to make sure they catch their flight. Beware! You'll be comfy at this one though!
review.positiveRemarks: They have some REALLY great staff!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Explaining the breakfast options!!!!!
review.locationRemarks: It's close to the airport.

review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport and free 4:00AM shuttle.

review.title: Overnight stay
review.reviewText: It was very nice.  We were only there overnight and then went to the airport.  We used the airport shuttle that was on time and left on time.  Very pleased.

review.title: Hotel Review
review.reviewText:
I've stayed at this hotel recently. I though the price I paid was reasonable but I would not go back to this hotel again. 
Pros: Good locations, cheap, and very friendly staffs. 
Cons: I found someone's hair (thank God it was hair from the head, not from other parts of the body) on my bed and also found the faucets in the shower area very dirty. The bed sheets didn't seem too clean, either. In the morning, the room gets pretty loud from the sound of cars passing outside the hotel. Usually, I'm not very sensitive to sounds when I sleep, but I could not go back to sleep after 6am. 
I would recommend this hotel to people who doesn't really care about the hygiene and only need a short stay.
Over price for this condition hotel, for me just rate only 2 1/2 star plus should not charge parking.

review.title: Close to highway
review.reviewText: Can hear cars on highway. Overall good price for hotel and only thing it sucks is parking. No free parking eventhough you book your room there.
For the price, it wasnt the best. Small and uncomfortable. Staff was very friendly.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Hotel room was ok but executive lounge was a disappointment - fairly small and only stocked with water and a coffee station. Certainly not worth the extra money paid for the use of this facility. Also my room was not made up after the first night - not sure if this was intentional or a genuine oversight.

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport.

I enjoyed my one night stay at the Crowne plaza hotel.
The hotel staff was very kind and welcoming.
My room was nice and comfy, very clean and relaxing.
The hotel has some nice samples of products to help you have a peaceful nights sleep.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: The first room I was given was at the freeway end of the building and very noisy, even after 10 pm.  So I asked for another room and was given one immediately.  I probably wasn't the first to make this complaint.  The second room was a bit more quiet, but the aircon was old and very noisy.  I was too tired to ask for another room change, so I just turned the aircon off.  For the night.
review.positiveRemarks: The shuttle bus driver was really trying his best
review.negativeRemarks: Move the hotel away from the freeway or install sound proof glass and new aircon equipment.
review.locationRemarks: Near airport

review.title: Close to airport

review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: Nice hotel for transit in famille trip
review.reviewText: Wé hâte to stay in tous hôtel for one time only one night. The staff dans vert helpful. We could let our lugagges early. The morning wé had to take the bus for thé airport. There was one every 20 minutes sterling 5am. The room was à little small.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of the room and a fridge in the room could be à great add on

review.reviewText: Carpet was old so was the furniture it smelled weird too

review.title: Vacay
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel and it was close to the airport. Room clean staff very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Clean rooms, friendly people, great location
review.reviewText: Overall it was a great stay for myself and my two children. We were very close to a great fishing spot as well as a short drive from the pier and airport. My only complaint was that it took for ever to get food from the restaurant. By the time it arrived my kids were so tired they could barely eat.

review.title: Nice hotel!
review.reviewText: This is the second time staying here while on vacation in SF. No complaints. Clean facility and right next to the freeway entrance/ exit. This is our place for visiting SF.

review.title: Wow, that carpet. Yuck!
review.reviewText: The beds, furniture, and bathroom were fine. I liked the bathroom configuration. Disappointments were: the carpet was absolutely filthy, full of stains. The room smelled like sweat socks. There was absolutely no way I would walk barefoot. The next morning I failed to take a whiff of the shampoo before I was all wet. The products (shampoo, conditioner-I had my own soap) smelled just like PineSol! I had no choice at that point, and had to suffer with the smell all day on a long, multi-stop, plane ride home. Lesson learned! My daughter had to pay $2 to park in the parking lot for 1/2 hour so she could say goodbye. There was no complimentary breakfast, but they did have a lounge on the 10th floor that "might" have donuts by the time I had to leave in the morning, and had 24-hour latte's. On the bright side, they had a free shuttle to the airport that left every 20 minutes. That was a great help. I would check out other hotels before staying there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was great. The airport shuttle was essential to my travel. The bathroom configuration was good, and the beds were clean.
review.negativeRemarks: The carpet was gross, filthy. Full of stains, and smelled like sweat socks. The shampoo, conditioner smelled like PineSol. Awful.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport, with a free shuttle. Really helped my travels.

review.title: Four people on a bed!
review.reviewText: Like I stated before,  how can four people sleep on a king size bed? I thought we were going to get a king size bed and a sofa bed. We got a VERY SMALL room with one king size bed. The nice lady in reception kept repeating king size bed to us. I thought she was just being accurate.  We got to our room and we're shocked. One bed for my wife, my two sons and I. We went back to reception and said this was not possible.  She said that was the reason she kept repeating the size of the bed. She was a little miffed, but stayed polite. She changed our room to two beds. TWO VERY SMALL BEDS! I though maybe they were two full beds.  THE Room WAS VERY SMALL.  She was not happy about having to change our room because Expedia should know what they are doing. The hotel looked busy also, so she had to look for a room. The lady in reception actually allowed us to check in early. That was very very nice.  The "breakfast included" was only for two people.  I don't remember this being stated When I made our reservation. We stayed 3 nights. I guess parking is like gold, because we had to pay $20 parking per night. That was stated in my reservation,  but odd for renting out a hotel room. Parking in San Francisco is extremely expensive. We actually paid $575 for our mini room, PLUS $60 for parking!  YES, A TOTAL OF $630 for 3 nights! I have made reservations from Expedia many many many times. This was the first time I have been disappointed. I guess no one is perfect.

review.title: An affordable place to stay with a wonderful staff
review.reviewText: It was pleasant hotel to stay at except for their cleanliness. They provide complimentary shuttle rides to the San Francisco International Airport and free guest WiFi. The beds we not as comfortable as we liked but it's a decent place to stay if you are concern with cost. Overall, the hotel is nice and there hotel staff is wonderful and friendly.

Printers in the business office did't work. I asked for help from the front desk to print our boarding passes. They were unable to do so from the front desk we proceeded to the back office where on the second try from the third computer the staff was able to print our tickets. Coo does for the never give up attitude but was it really necessary to go through so much to accomplish such a simple task?
review.negativeRemarks: Would be nice if computers and printers were linked together. Saves time for the staff not to have to search as to what is networked to what.
review.locationRemarks: Not a lot of places to eat, but its proximity to the airport was convenient.

review.title: Convenient to SFO airport and comfortable
review.reviewText: This hotel was easy to get to from the airport and had good comfortable rooms and good facilities. I would use it again if I had a transit through SFO
review.positiveRemarks: convenience to the airport, comfortable rooms, nice facilities
review.locationRemarks: We went to Gabriel and Daniel's Mexican cafeteria within walking distance - great food and prices only downside is the café like ambiance.

review.title: Good stay.
review.reviewText: It was a good stay not all the kids need is a pool to have fun.

review.title: nice near sfo
review.reviewText: The shuttle arrived when they said. Free vouchers for drinks and a good free breakfast buffet. Nice clean room. Early morning shuttle back to SFO.

Overall, reasonable price for an SFO location and 1-2 night stay.  Unfortunately, 2nd floor room was older/inferior to previous ones I booked at this hotel.

Poor walk score ... need to drive to get anywhere decent (e.g., to wider variety of restaurants, shops, etc.).  However, parking is extra, and pricey.
review.positiveRemarks: Overall, reasonable price for SFO location and 1-2 night stay.  However, 2nd floor room was older/inferior to previous ones I booked at this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Maintain/upgrade the room (e.g., bathroom caulking was missing in spots, some moldy tiles overhead).  Also, vending machines wouldn't take dollars.
review.locationRemarks: Poor walk score ... need to drive to get anywhere decent (e.g., to wider variety of restaurants, shops, etc.).

review.title: Perfectly nice hotel
review.reviewText: Inexpensive, near the airport, clean, comfortable. What more do you need?

review.title: Good and comfortable stay. Warm greetings by staff
review.reviewText:
It was a pleasant experience - felt very welcome at the front desk for check-in and staff was very welcoming. I was offered to access their 10th floor bar for a cup of complementary coffee, which was very courteous! 

The room is clean and quiet, and the bed was comfortable. 

The hotel staff helped scheduled my taxi the next morning and everything went smooth and swift.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Great staff!  Very friendly.  Very clean room, good food at the west bay cafe, and great amenities. Highly recommend!

review.title: Need new carpet
review.reviewText: We were in a non-smoking room and there were burn marks and filth all over the carpet. The lobby was getting carpet cleaned and it should've been removed versus clean it so old looking.

review.title: One night stand
review.reviewText: I would not recommend it's horrible carpet wore duty bathroom noise toilet . Plus $20 parking. Not worth the money.

Stayed 3 nights. Room was clean, quiet and hotel was nice. Very pleasant staff.  Good food in the restaurant downstairs was really tasty, a little pricey.  Easy access to the highway. Very close to little eateries, starbucks etc. Bed not that comfy but must hotel beds aren't. Would stay here again.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: overall I had a pleasant experience, staff was friendly, helpful, the room was comfortable, clean

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Staff was very nice and extremely attentive to our needs

review.title: Staff great, room in need of remodel
review.reviewText: Can't say all rooms need some upkeep but rm 232 had soiled carpets and a shower head in disrepair. There was a constant drip of water down the building from condensation from other Ac units above. Now for the good, our bed was great and that was all that mattered as we were on a 7 hour layover.

review.title: That's totally nice.
review.reviewText:
Close to SFO. I only took 30 min from the hotel through checking-in the flight via rental car return.
My room was on 2nd floor where was very close to 101 fwy.
But it was not so noisy. I was not aware of it at all.
Eventually I recommend this hotel.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Dropping off my wife for a flight to the Far East we were able to get some rest before her long flight and though the proximity to the 101 freeway was close I got a gpod nights sleep before a long drive the next morning.

review.title: They could have made it better.
review.reviewText: We arrived around 12:15am expecting a good rest in a nice room. We had called twice reminding the staff we had sensitive hearing and needed a quite room. Upon arriving they gave us our keys and off we went. Upon stepping off the elevator, the carpet looked old. When we got to our room the closet still had a shoebox full of trash, the ironing board was just thrown in the closet. The bathroom floor wasn't clean either. When we asked for a different room, they gave us a room on the same floor with a barking dog in the next room!! We finally went down to the lobby and called out that our room was a disaster. That got the attention of the staff and they gave us a better room on the 7th floor.
The hotel was a surprise from my last visit. It looks like it has been getting remodeled. Last time was a bad experience.

review.title: Nice Hotel for the traveler
review.reviewText: Everything was great!! The staff was very friendly and cheerfull.. The only thing i would have to say would be negative is that we had to pay $20 for parking. I travel a lot out of town and hardly ever pay for parking but i inderstand most hotels neer airports or tourist attractions charge.. The orher thing was the indoor swimming pool.. Although it was sufficiant i thought it was very tiny for the type of hotel it was and quality.. Besides that the family enjoyed the stay!

Visiting missions for 4th grade reports; we weren't planning on staying in area but with traffic & 2 kids we just wanted out! Called Expedia & found hotel with indoor pool which was great kept kids busy. The room was clean but the beds were not queens a bit smaller. Our room was right next to elevator, so we heard it all night long! Good thing we were exhausted!!
review.negativeRemarks: bigger beds

review.reviewText: The room could have been better. the bed wasn't comfortable, the bathroom was clean.

review.title: Excellent customer service
review.reviewText: The hotel staff bent over backwards to accommodate us. They were friendly, professional and prompt. We will definitely make this our hotel when we return to SF.

Was able to check in early big+ room service staff where having what seems to be a laod party in the room next door for wage seems like ever, after calling the front desk things started to quite down gradually big -
Parking gate wide open ( broken) but still got charged for parking.
Not a bad place but for the price I prefer other places.

review.title: hidden charge ruined the value
review.reviewText: great price on line then $20 to park for the night.  For another $20 there were better choices in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: truth in advertising

review.title: Peasant stay
review.reviewText: I stayed only for a few hours just to get some sleep had to catch an early flight,over all nice and clean hotel. No bad review on my book.

review.title: Accessible to the Airport
review.reviewText: I will recommend this hotel ! Quiet, clean and the most important is accessible to the airport.

review.title: Old, no value for money
review.reviewText: The room has no fridge, bad lights .. And no ocean view but that could be cause I was given a room on third floor. Broken vendor machines on different floors that take money Nd give nothing .,,
Good experience overall. The only issue I encountered was that it took a long time for the the toilet to fill up with water after each flush.

review.title: Decent Hotel near airport
review.reviewText: The staff was always cheerful and helpful.  The floors/carpet in the entire hotel seemed very dirty.  Did not want to walk around without shoes.  The ceiling tiles in the bathroom seemed stained and dirty.  Restaurant was very overpriced for the quality of the food.  The staff in the restaurant came across as if they did not want to be there consequently the service was poor.
review.positiveRemarks: close to the bay walking trail.
review.negativeRemarks: As stated above a good deep cleaning and improvement to the food and attitude of staff in the restaraunt
review.locationRemarks: was there for a conference did not get to leave the hotel for fun activites.

review.reviewText: Rundown and dilapidated hotel next to the 101. While the freeway noise was loud and kept our family up at night, it was the horrifying sewage odor permeating the entire hotel that was the most offensive element during our 3 night stay. The odor was so offensive that it was headache inducing on at least one of the days during our stay. Would not return to this hotel not would I ever recommend to anyone else.
Great location and timely shuttles to the airport

review.title: Great Staff
review.reviewText: We had a question and the staff went to the room to double check and make sure we got the right room.  Great place!

review.title: Great Work Hotel
review.reviewText: I was in town for a workshop so spent little time at the hotel but when there it was comfortable and quiet considering the location near the airport. Room was clean and staff very friendly.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to the airport
review.reviewText: It was a nice hotel that was near the convention I went to.  I didn't use the facilities but they had a restaurant/bar, pool, and gym. Even though it was near the airport, they soundproofed it so that it didn't bother me or my mother.

review.title: OK room for a quick solution while between flights
review.reviewText: Nothing special. Room was tired looking but clean. Served its purpose as an in-between flight solution.  Shuttle service was EXCELLENT.

review.title: Out for a family matter...
review.reviewText:
Stayed in Room 606; clean and neat, but LOTS of road noise. (Overlooks the freeway.)

The café left a fair amount of room for improvement. 
The cheese burger was OK, but a bit underdone. A 'local craft brew' was $8 for a 12 ounce can*! (*Not explained on the menu.)

The breakfast buffet (~$14) had scrambled eggs, hash browns- COLD!, bacon/sausage and French toast.  I thought about ordering eggs off the menu (~$12-18) but then I saw that the servers were picking things (hash browns, fruit, etc.) from the buffet line to fill the custom order. 

Coffee was tepid and lacked flavour.
review.positiveRemarks: Check in was fast and efficient.
review.negativeRemarks: Most of the room doors were dirty/scuffed. Looked worn and not necessarily kept up.

review.title: It was located close to Millbrae Bart Station.
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly.  The room was comfortable.

The bathroom smelled like a moldy mop. The walls are thin; I had to listen to a kid crying all night. The hotel is next to the freeway so I also had the privilege of listening to road construction all night. It's ok if you just need a place to crash for the night close to the airport.

review.title: Small room for large price
review.reviewText: Room was small, breakfast buffet French toast was cold, didn't provjde fresh towels when all others were dirty

review.title: Convenient location at good price
review.reviewText: We choose the hotel based on its proximity to SFO. We fly frequently from/to SFO and need to stay overnight near it. Having stayed in many hotels in the area, it's our first time trying out this Crowne Plaza. The facility is in a good shape compare to others in the same price range near SFO and the location convenient to restaurants and shops in Millbrae. However, a little glitch upon check-in showed that the staff at the front desk require more attention to the business and enthusiasm towards the guests.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff needs to be trained to pay more attention to what's going on at the counter, not just follow her own preset routine of checking the computer.
review.locationRemarks: SFO, nice restaurants and shopping malls are nearby. BART terminal to SF city center is also a short ride away.

review.title: Very Noisy
review.reviewText:
Very very noisy A/C unit.
A lot of noise from Hwy 101, SFO Airport and train.
Lot of small flying insects in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: A/C unit
review.locationRemarks: New England Lobster Co. is a great place to eat

review.title: Spend only one night
review.reviewText: It's located near the airport, but in an area that is dark and without easy walking access to any other places.  Just good enough to spend the night after a tiring trip.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Excellent customer service. Convenient location to airport and SF

review.title: Close to SFO, and highway
review.reviewText: Convenient shuttle every 30 min, dont have to call. Bring earplugs though, my room had a lot of highway noise. Cold water in bathroom sink also didn't work but wasn't a big deal.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Vomit found on pillow. Overall ok. Must have been an oversight. Had to pay for parking but they were negotiable.

review.title: Hot tub and pool super small
review.reviewText: Got told before booking that pool and hot tub are open 24/7 but it wasn't true.

review.title: Well located for airport access
review.reviewText: Staff was great the pillows at room a bit flat but not a reason to not stay again enjoy it and would recommend to anybody traveling to San Francisco located next to airport

review.title: Nice place but far from fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and the room is well maintained. The hotel staff was courteous. The only problem was the location though it is very close to the San Francisco airport and the Bart station and you can get to the airport using the hotel shuttle but the overall travel time to San Francisco Downtown and Fisherman's wharf is at least 1 to 1.5 hours. Taking a cab from the hotel to Fisherman's wharf will cost you around $65.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant at the hotel hardly had any vegetarian options on the menu. More vegetarian options should be added.

review.title: Don't take a 2nd floor room
review.reviewText: They gave us a room on the second floor and there's a roof right next to our windows. 8am our second day there and guys are working on the roof area with hammers, not a real pleasant thing to wake up to.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Knowing that maintenance is going to be working in area, not assign rooms to people in that vicinity.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to city and other places around Bay area. Even though construction was going on with freeway (101) it was easy to get on and off.

review.reviewText: Ours was brief-a famuly dinner Saturday evening...would RAELLY be nice if the parking was free!  Nice clean hotel..we enjoyed out stay..thanks!

The hotel is located close to the airport.  As I checked in...I had a pleasant surprise. My room was upgraded to Executive room with access to executive lounge.  The hotel also accepted my request for a late check out.

review.title: great amenities, a little noisy at night though
review.reviewText: the amenities are great, close to Burlingame where you can find a lot of restaurants. Might get a little bit noisy during night since it is very close to airport. And 20 bucks per night for parking is just too much.

I only stayed overnight between airplane flights so I appreciated the airport to hotel shuttle a lot.  The front desk people were very nice and having the cafe in the building was very convenient (and the food was tasty).  The room was very comfortable, clean and well appointed.

review.title: It has an indoor pool for kids...
review.reviewText: The rooms are so small, the carpets are filthy, and the paint is coming off in a corner ceiling ( they moved us to another room after a long debate with this Indian lady named "Satiya",she vehemently refuses to give us another room, until another lady that works in the front desk, pointed to her that there's a suite available.

review.title: Airport Crowne Plaza
review.reviewText:
Warm welcoming staff. Close proximity to the Airport with a free shuttle service. Our Rooms were clean, well appointed and a great value for what our family needed.
The Dining room offered us a meal that provided variety at a reasonable value.

All in all we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this Hotel to our family or friends

review.title: Nice hotel with clean rooms close to SFO airport
review.reviewText: The staff were gracious, friendly and very helpful. the porter even went back down to get me some bottled water when I came in late and exhausted for my 1 night stay before leaving the next morning to go home. Super lovely folks. The room was a little tight and the plug on the bathtub was broken, so I couldn't take the much wanted bath, but other than that it was a nice stay and I have no complaints.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to the airport, free shuttle to the airport and the lovely staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel in general needs some updating and remodeling. Rooms are small and a few things needed repair.
review.locationRemarks: I came i late and left early so really don't know what's close by.

review.title: Curb appeal.
review.reviewText: I believe that this hotel can do more for it's lobby decor and presence. It felt outdated when I came in. Registration people were great, but the lobby and registration desk didn't look at all welcoming. Needs a revamp people. The parking entrance never had an accessible person to talk to if your ticket couldn't get you in because the rain did  havoc to the electronics. I tried buzzing for help and no one got on the speaker to help me and I was forced to go back and get out of my car in the rain to talk to someone at the front desk. Excellent customer service and customer satisfaction gets them back at your door people. That's basic Hotel 101 stuff.  On the positive side, the staff were friendly, smiling and accommodating. Especially the staff at the bar and restaurant. That goes a long way in my book.
review.negativeRemarks: Read first entry
review.locationRemarks: Hang a few more lights on your trees during the holiday season to make it more festive and keeps with the Christmas spirit. Don't skimp on curb appeal

review.reviewText: One of the things that I must highlight is its cleanliness.

review.title: disappointed
review.reviewText: When we arrived there was not a bell person to help us carry our luggage and we had a lot of luggage. The hotel room needed painting and so did the restaurant, the food was not hot or fresh. The staff was ok, but lack of professionalism.  Will not stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: It had new towels, and we liked the transportation they provided to the airport and to town.
review.negativeRemarks: Renovation to the entire building
review.locationRemarks: Transportation to downtown and to the airport

review.reviewText: Double beds are a bit small but we appreciated the location to the SF airport and it was reasonably priced.

It was a pleasant night ... 
I like the view .... I recommend it ..

near to airport
not very clean and the furniture are dated and stained

review.title: Great hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: Less expensive compared to the other Crown Plaza down the 101 in Foster City. I think this one is cleaner, but comparing the two Crown Plazas, this one has a less comfortable beds. Okay for 1 or 2 nights, but any more and I'm sure my back would start hurting. Maybe it was just that one bed.
review.negativeRemarks: new sleeping pad
review.locationRemarks: Near airport, close to highways and SF is just a few minutes drive. Hop on BART and get to SF!

review.title: Breakfast included
review.reviewText: When I was looking for my hotel, I search hotels with breakfast included but when I was in the hotel the staff told me that it is not included!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean but  the heather is too noisy
review.negativeRemarks: heather is too noisy
review.locationRemarks: Was ok

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Too much construction going on and it was a little hard to get there.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean.  Front staff were very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators were too old.

review.title: Great Weelkend Wedding Stay
review.reviewText: Conveniently located to airport and adorable Burlingame shops and eateries. Was there for a wedding and able to quickly run and grab wine and gift wrap along with yummy breakfast 5 minutes away.
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff and assistance with any needs.
review.locationRemarks: If in between flights check out the coffee shops or wine store on Broadway.

review.title: decent hotel
review.reviewText: the room was clean and comfortable enough - just stayed for a quick one night. Got in late and left early so didn't use restaurant or any facilities.
review.positiveRemarks: close to airport and freeway, easy to find
review.negativeRemarks: cost for parking (20.00)
review.locationRemarks: close to airport and not far from the city if you are driving

review.title: UNSATISFACTORY
review.reviewText: UNSATISFACTORY.  I couldn't wait to leave.  I wrote more but you rejected my review.  Now you want more.
review.negativeRemarks: I tried to tell you and you rejected my review.
review.locationRemarks: Don't know.

review.reviewText: The hotel is in an ideal location.  The staff was excellent.

review.title: Hotel near the SFO airport
review.reviewText:
The room was neat, clean and attractive. Disappointments:  1. I couldn't set the alarm on the combination radio-CD player-clock; it was too complicated.  2. There was no refrigerator in the room. I need a refrigerator with a freezer for my medicine. I've had this necessity at other hotels that are less attractive. 3. There was no microwave in the room, which didn't inconvenience me but it would for others. 4. My dinner in the dining room was just so-so.

The staff was friendly and the shuttle to the airport met my needs.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location and the shuttle to and from the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: See above,

review.title: excellent stay from long flight
review.reviewText: booked this for my parents and they were extremely happy. thank you!

review.title: It's convenient to SFO airport
review.reviewText: The buffet breakfast was good and the room was very clean.  The hotel is close enough to SF downtown by car.  The weekend rate was very reasonable thru Expedia.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText:
I was there for only one night
Clean rooms,very comfortable rooms very nice clean but you still could eared the airplaines from the airport

Hotel registration staff were some of the best customer service professionals I have had the pleasure of engaging with during an overnight stay. Hotel air poet location and convenience to Burlingame via town Trolley were value added benefits. Room itself ok.

review.title: SFO Hotel
review.reviewText: I  enjoyed my stay, however I was disappointed to pay 20$ for the parking.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the executive room with coffee and pastries on the morning and the cleanliness of the room.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom could be better, not match with the rest of the level of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport easy to reach.

review.reviewText:
The hotel staff were very friendly for my one night stay. My room was surprisingly quiet given how close to the freeway the hotel is.
I asked the hotel to call for a taxi. They called a town car instead. Not sure if the $17 charge to take me about 2 miles away would have been mor reasonable with a regular taxi. Overall it was a good value and I would stay there again.

review.title: Close to airport
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf

review.title: Disappointing, even for an airport hotel.
review.reviewText: We stayed for a quick overnight between flights.  This hotel is close to the airport and there is a shuttle service, which was very handy.  However, the room was disappointing . . . very basic room that didn't feel very clean.  There were stains on the carpet.  Would probably choose a different hotel next time.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the airport and had shuttle service
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness in the rooms could be improved

review.title: Our room was beside a noisy elevator
review.reviewText: Our room that was given to us was beside the elevator, NOISY !!!

review.title: Convenient hotel close to SFO.
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel because we had a flight very early next day. The hotel is OK for its purpose. They have a very good and clean bed and the room is quiet so you can have a good sleep. They charge for parking so be aware.

review.title: Would have expected more from a Crown Plaza.
review.reviewText: Very outdated hotel (but I hear the 60s were good years in the Bay Area).  Food in bar area was okay at best ($10 for a burger), but lots of loud drunks kind of ruined the dinner vibe.  Shower water handle came off in my wife's hands when she went to take a shower at 5:30 in the morning ... had to go to front counter and get maintenance guy to come screw it back on.  Overheard another customer at front counter giving them both barrels re: the quality of their hotel ... dude was ticked off.  Pay a couple of bucks more and stay somewhere else ... my first and last visit here.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.
review.locationRemarks: Picked this hotel only because of close proximity of SFO.

review.reviewText: Excellent choice for convenience to airport.  Reception desk and restaurant staff very friendly and efficient.

review.title: convenient
review.reviewText: Only negative was the breakfast in the Cafe....waited forever to be served.
review.positiveRemarks: guest services were wonderful.  Provided us with a deck of cards just for the asking!

review.title: A/c noisy.
review.reviewText: A/C kept me up. Every time it turned on it sounded like a washing machine. Very loud.....

review.title: Adequate hotel, close to airport
review.reviewText:
Hard to find, seems like it is the last stop of airport hotels.  Really lacking in decorative imagination,  blah, uninspiring.

Restaurant needs overhaul and staff training......very untidy behind bar, staff lack pride in job.

Executive lounge offers nothing...except watery coffee.....bad

Uptick, close to the airport........only positive.
review.negativeRemarks: Color scheme is so plain, the whole hotel looks like it needs major overhaul.  Nothing attractive about the facility.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect distance to airport! N/a to 2nd part of question

review.negativeRemarks: rates

review.title: Short stay
review.reviewText: Bed sheet was very stiff and pillow was too soft.  Nice shower.  Did not like that I have to pay $20 dollars for parking.  Took a long time to check in as the person was not very experience (a trainee) and couldn't find our reservation.
review.negativeRemarks: Better pillow and bed sheet

review.title: Good airport hotel
review.reviewText: We just stayed one night in between flights. Very comfortable and reasonably priced. Had an excellent dinner in the restaurant. Staff very pleasant.

review.title: Good to revisit.
review.reviewText: Excellent by the price. but vending was out of order. Shuttle service and free internet were good.
review.positiveRemarks: Shuttle service, free internet, kind staff, good price.
review.locationRemarks: Nearby SFO, perfect for stay with calm. No club, though.

review.title: Reasonable for the price.
review.reviewText: Okay. It was just as much as expected for the price. Perfect for stop over staying.

review.title: Good hotel for a brief stay. close to airport.
review.reviewText: Good for stay for a night or two. It is close to airport and south san francisco, good location if you are in that area. Stay away from rooms near elevator since there is a lot of noise.

Not clean enough 
I need to ask them give me the tooth brush
Need to put some deposit

review.title: Quality room!
review.reviewText: Quality room!  Got upgraded to executive level and it was nice! Wynter was ver corteous!

review.title: Perfectly-equipped for ADA customers
review.reviewText:
My wife checked in with a broken leg, and the staff from Reception to Housekeeping to Restaurant were unbelievably well-trained to assist and serve a wheelcair-bound customer.   Carmelia and William, were exceptional at the reception desk.   They moved heaven and earth to accommodate my wife's early check-in.  Carmelia went so far as to come and collect us from the restaurant.
Patty of housekeeping was exceptionally helpful to my wife while I was out hosting a foreign delegation from my company.   The restaurant staff at the West Bay Cafe served us wonderful meals and made each breakfast a warm and welcome experience.  
The Bell staff were organized and did an incredible job of processing some twenty pieces of luggage from four rooms of delegates.   
I have used Crowne Plaza Burlingame in the past because I was impressed by the well-trained staff.  Now, I have no doubt that Crowne Plaza Burlingame is the only San Francisco airport hotel i will use for my company, in future.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were exceptionally well-trained for ADA customers.  They almost seemed to be designed for this.
review.negativeRemarks: I can find no fault with the service to suggest any improvement.   The staff genuinely seemed to enjoy their work and take pride in their hotel.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is within five minutes of a host of excellent eating places and pictureque downtown Burligame is only ten minutes away.

review.title: $20 per night for parking
review.reviewText: Was not expecting parking fee for a hotel located where it is at.

review.negativeRemarks: carpets are old and tired

staff was very friendly and helpful
gave me a 2pm late check out at no charge

Hotel stay was pleasant. Clean and quiet, although it is close to the airport and freeway I wasn't disturbed by any outside noise.  The room was small but clean. Location is not the most convenient as it is away from most businesses and restuarants but the West End Bay Cafe in the hotel has good food and the staff was very prompt and accommodating...

Room were fine, staff friendly but you can definitely hear the noise in the morning, afternoon and evening. Very convenient place to stay if you need to catch and early morning flight.
Great hotel close to SFO. WiFi was good for a hotel, room was decorated nice and was clean.

review.title: Airport close to hotel
