review.title: No frig
review.reviewText: No refrigerator in the room. So I could not enjoy a throat of cold drink when I wanted.

review.title: Looks like a good deal online
review.reviewText: I looked it up on line the place looked pretty cool ... When I got into the room  it looked like there was a fight in the room it was cleaned but the walls had battle scars not to mention there was splatters of dried blood  on wall was expecting some thing nicer!!!

review.title: Transit stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was perfect for my transit stay of less than 12 hours. The shuttle arrived. I checked in quickly and the staff was most helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: lessen parking fees

review.title: Went on and bid on a room.
review.reviewText: We wanted a room near the airport to make our return trip home. We need a shuttle service to get us there on time. The Crowe Plaza passed all these tests with flying colors.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was helpful. Everyone who worked for the hotel thanked us for our business.
review.negativeRemarks: The food in the restaurant was Ok. I had a burger and bun tasted old.
review.locationRemarks: Airport near by.

review.title: Crowne Plaza Disappoints
review.reviewText: The best thing about the Crowne Plaza is that they had an airport shuttle.  Room was dark and lamp shade was stained.  Not what I was expecting.
review.negativeRemarks: Lights and decor

review.title: Next to fwy, and very close to airport.
review.reviewText: Traveled with child, so it's kid friendly, pool very clean.

review.title: great hotel for the airpoet ----
review.reviewText: very nice front desk -- great room for the value --- would definitely return !!

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: In the SFO Airport area a good alternative for the price
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby
review.locationRemarks: Nothing special

review.title: A real hotel for a good price
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel so we could pick up a friend at the airport and then we all went to visit San Francisco the next day.
review.positiveRemarks: I had a very good steak in the restaurant.

review.title: Nice hotel near airport
review.reviewText: Pleasent stay, hotel is near airport shuttle bus picks you up and takes you strait to your terminal

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: Excellente situation pour cet hôtel à proximité de l aeroport
review.positiveRemarks: Personnel competent , Bon restaurant, proximity of the airport with rapid shuttle

review.reviewText: Everything was great. The location and conevenience was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Close proximity to the airport
review.reviewText: The drive to the airport was short and sweet but the hotel itself was rather disappointing, especially the comfort of the bed and the easy access of the outlets.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds.

review.reviewText: I had reservation for two nights at this hotel.  They had overbooked for the first night so when I arrived at the hotel about midnight they told me they were sending me to another hotel.   They paid for the cab fare to another lodging.  I returned  the second night to this hotel, cab fare covered by them.
review.negativeRemarks: Carpet needed to be vacuumed.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is off a major highway.  It's difficult to get around unless you have a car. There is a shuttle van that takes one to downtown Burlingame.

review.title: Will never book this hotel again
review.reviewText: Not as good as other Crown Palaza. My friend stayed there for 3 nights and was disappointed.
review.locationRemarks: Burlingame, CA

review.title: Room fine but restaurant a problem
review.reviewText: My room and linens were clean and that is probably the most important aspect of any hotel stay. Also everything in the room functioned fine. The restaurant was a very frustrating and real problem, however. Extremely slow service, just good enough quality food most of the time but nothing great, and unfortunately they closed every night at 11 pm. A bar that closes at 11 pm! It was terrible. We walked to another hotel to use the other hotel's bar. Didn't make any sense to us. Don't expect to get a quick breakfast.

The staff were very friendly and helpful! I'm just really disappointed with the overall image of the hotel. My husband and I use to love staying here. The furniture and pool needs a lot of remodeling. The interior design of the room is old and the furniture was chipped badly. I felt the room was very overpriced for the overall actual image of the place.

review.title: Hoodwinked in Burlingame
review.reviewText: An acquaintance told me about the Crown Plaza he'd stayed at in Sacramento.  He said his visit was very enjoyable, the staff was friendly and helpful, and he recommended the hotel.  I assumed the one I made reservations at for two nights in Burlingame would be similar.  It wasn't.  I was so disappointed that I will never give this hotel another chance.  Once was more than enough.  Hallway carpets duct-taped together so guests wouldn't trip, stains throughout the facility on carpets (elevators, hallways).  There was even about a foot of pipe insulation laying in the floor of our room beside the air conditioner.  Even though they made up our room, they never removed the insulation.  Shoddy housekeeping, and inferior management.  Subpar accommodations for the money paid.  Lesson learned, I guess.  Hope you have a better experience.
review.locationRemarks: Better accommodations everywhere along the same street.  Been to them, should have gone back.

review.reviewText: It was comfortable and close to the airport. There is a lot of food to eat near the hotel, but you need to eat early enough. Majority of the restaurants close at 10PM..
review.positiveRemarks: Great area to walk and run for exercise
review.negativeRemarks: Better rate to park at the hotel

review.title: Horrible experience!
review.reviewText: Bed was the worst I've ever slept on and I travel a lot! Sheets were like plastic...so uncomfortable! Electricity went out for hours...had to shave in the dark for a wedding! Management wasn't apologetic at all!

review.title: Hotel close to the SF airport
review.reviewText: Hotel was close to the freeway and convenient to our semiar.  Was unaware of the 18.00 parking fee for use of their own parking lot.   There was a weird smell in the hallway on the 9th floor.  Room was nice, didn't like the glow in the dark bed frame and beds were hard and mine leaned when you got close the the edge.  Staff was friendly and helpful and free breakfast was nice.

review.title: Great stay! Treated like a king!
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with my recent stay! I was in a position where I needed to have a meeting with 4 others and was granted a late checkout that worked with my schedule. I believe they went way above the call of duty on this one for me and I WILL return in the future!
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms, staff, proximity to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast buffet could have been a little fresher but we came in late.

review.title: Keep Looking...not worth the money
review.reviewText: I arrived to the front desk where 3 agents did not even pick up there heads to greet me and I was the only person standing there. While I was getting checked in a young man goes up to one of the agents and jokingly asks her to translate something in spanish and laughs as she replies you know I don't speak spanish. Then the two agents start talking in their language. That's just rude. Anyway got to the room and spots of the popcorn ceiling was gone and the wallpaper had begun to peel away from the wall, in addition it was a handicap unit. We asked to move units and though they seemed hesitant they moved us next door which had the same issues! we gave up and decided to stay in the unit. Our key's kept expiring and when we couldn't enter the parking gate and pressed the button to be let in the guy said to just come by the front desk, no apology?? The second time we came back after a long night to the door and the key didn't work, yet still no apology?? The lack of service and condition of unit was very dissapointing.
review.negativeRemarks: customer service and condition of rented units.

review.title: Just a close to the airport hotel
review.reviewText: We were able to get there early evening which allowed us to return our car early and use the hotel shuttle to get back to the hotel and to the airport in the morning, It is a hotel with upgrades being completed so it was not quite to the standards of other Crown Plaza's I have used this year. But the staff was terrific and the food good. Location was convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: closeness to airport and friendly staff.

review.title: Decent hotel and restaurant. Close to ball park.
review.reviewText: Quiet despite being close to airport. Nice ball park to walk around next to hotel. Good hours for breakfast, lunch and dinner to be served. Good shuttle, on time and leaves every 30 minutes. Friendly staff.
review.locationRemarks: Five field baseball park next door, walk to water and watching of planes. Nothing else within walking distance of any importance.

review.title: Rooms were very run down.
review.reviewText: Stay at the Holiday Inn Express( especially, the Redwood City location ) instead. Skip the breakfast. It's a joke, as is their free( never available when you need it shuttle).
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle schedule, food choices ( room service )
review.locationRemarks: SFO airport area (Burlingame) & San Mateo (just south) are beautiful. Highly recommend Kincaid's for dinner; get there before 7p to avoid waiting.

review.title: Never again
review.reviewText: I stayed in this hotel one night. After a long flight you want to have some rest but the noise kept me up. Eventually I had to take sleeping pills. Don't recommend this hotel to anybody.

review.title: The rooms are small but vey comfortable
review.reviewText: We were only there for one night awaiting a flight but a good room for a fair price
Don't see why they charge for parking, out rageous amout of $18 p/d
review.negativeRemarks: not charging for the basics i.e. parking, wifi

review.title: Nice Hotel--Great Staff!
review.reviewText: Even though this hotel is about a 30 minute ride to downtown San Francisco, it is very close to the airport if you are flying. The airport and freeway did make it a little noisy; but the room was very comfortable (great bed and pillows), and the staff was exceptional. As good as it was, it would have been nice to have a refrigerator and microwave.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed and pillows Great staff
review.negativeRemarks: Better noise control Refrigerator and microwave in the room $18 a night is a little steep for self parking
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport Downtown San Francisco about a 30-minute drive (Golden Gate Bridge, Ghirardelli Square, Pier 39, China Town, Lombard Street)

review.title: Great hotel, horrible room service
review.reviewText:
Great location to take a jog near the water. Nice interior decor.

Horrible room service!!!!!! Every night that called for room service I had to leave a meessge because of no answer. Every night when they returned the call to take my order ot was between 45 min to a hour wait for the returned call. Maybe they are Understaffed in the kitchen.
The hotel and staff were very nice. I was not expecting to be charged $18 to park my car for the night. It would have helped if that was mentioned in the write up for the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: It was just off the highway and easy to get back on to get to the airport.

review.title: crowne plazza
review.reviewText: it wiuld have been better if the carpet in the room did not have big stains..I did let them know at the reception desk.....

review.title: Hotel needs lots of work
review.reviewText: Only one night. Dingy and dirty lobby. Restaurant wAs the best thing there. Small room with tiny bathroom. Would not stay again. Expect more from a Crown Plaza!!

review.title: Nice hotel noisy near freeway
review.reviewText:
When we were there they were replacing all the windows
Probably less noisy now. Personally I didn't mind it
At breakfast which was nice the milk was outdated and off and they claimed there was none in the whole hotel
Waiter was jolly, but too jolly and annoying

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: Because of the location of near from I-101, the room is noisy in the night. Therefore, the hotel will provide you a pair of ear plug.

review.title: Convenience is the only reason
review.reviewText: This looked like an old building someone slapped a Crowne Plaza sign on. Overpriced, poor value. Proximity to the airport is the only plus.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the facility. Bring prices for consumable back into the stratosphere
review.locationRemarks: Bypass the hotel restaurant bar and walk 1/8 of a mile to Max's Restaurant and Bar in front of the Holiday Inn Express

review.title: overnighter
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, easy to get to. Staff very efficient and kind. Hot tub a little small. Price was right. Gave us an upgrade.

review.title: Customer service
review.reviewText: Staff was rude when answering questions. Having four people in a family each room, I was given a king size bed instead of 2 queens each room rented. The ages of each kid was given, and it is obvious that 2 beds each room is necessary. It was a disappointment and I will never stay in this hotel again.

review.title: In need of a redo
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly and no major complaints but decor worn and tired. They are redoing the windows to reduce freeway noise but right now it is pretty bad. I upgraded to a delux room but probably wasted money. I think it is very over priced.
review.positiveRemarks: Shuttle service to SFO was good. The resturant was OK and check in was smooth and efficient.
review.negativeRemarks: Either upgrade everything or reduce the price. WiFi is free but at dial up speed.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing is near this hotel.

review.title: If you Don't Ask.
review.reviewText: We did get a newly renovated room until we demanded one and only got the room facing the freeway!

review.title: Convenient for SF Intl. Airport
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because I needed to stay near the airport to pick up my family the next day. It is right off the 101 and minutes from the airport. The facility is nice, has all the amenities and had friendly staff. There is a parking fee though. All in all a very nice hotel, with an on-site restaurant, pool, gym, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds weren't as comfortable as they could be

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Our room was small since we asked for an extra rolling bed but everything else was good. We left satisfied.

review.title: One of the nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText:
The good experience was having a few drinks at your bar.
The bad experience was unable to swim one evening due to too many children
playing in the pools & adults filled up the jacuzzi.
review.positiveRemarks: Jacuzzi & indoor swimming pool, easy excess in and out of the building.
review.negativeRemarks: The swimming pools & Jacuzzi seems outdated and not well maintained. Need to be upgraded so to show clearer water and cleaner.

review.reviewText: all was great... it was a bit loud, but the hum of the climate control drowned out the traffic noice and allowed me to sleep.

review.title: OK for overnight stays
review.reviewText: I had a 20 hour layover at SFO, so I needed a place to stay for the night. I chose the Crowne Plaza because of its close proximity to the airport. For overnight stays, this hotel is fine. My room was clean and comfortable, the hotel staff was courteous and efficient. However, I would not recommended this hotel for longer stays because it's located next to Highway 101. I knew the room would be noisy when I saw the earplugs placed on the desk by hotel staff. I left the AC fan on all night to drown out the freeway noise. This hotel would be fine for business travelers, not so good for vacationers.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to SFO, free airport shuttle and free wifi. Room was spacious and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Replace the single pane windows in the rooms with double pane insulated windows.
review.locationRemarks: I did not spend enough time at the hotel to do any sightseeing.

review.title: Room right next to 101 ?
review.reviewText: Not a place to rest. If you like to stay up all night, then the trafficker noise will definitely help!
review.negativeRemarks: Well, not to rent half of the rooms?

review.title: Stained carpets hotel yuk!
review.reviewText: Carpets were dirty and stains were all over the floor, do not walk barefoot. Definitely not worth the price. I would not book this hotel again.

review.title: Pleasant experience
review.reviewText: After flying into San Francisco Airport from the UK, the nights stay at the hotel was a very pleasant experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: If you HAVE to stay near SFO
review.reviewText:
Upon arrival, there was little parking to make for a convenient check-in. Front desk was . . . almost warm and friendly. My room was on the 8th floor - sounds good! 8th floor, end of the building - ehhh. The room itself - ceiling obviously had been damaged by water, and scraped for now. Looked nasty! No one should have to stay in a room that looked so damaged!!! (even at discount rates!) And gross!!! The bed was horrible!! It creaked, squeaked, sounded unstable, and plastic. You could hear the springs every time you made the slightest move. Linens - SO awful!!!! The "comforter" sounded like it was wrapped in plastic, or maybe it was plastic. It was NOT soft, warm, comforting, did not mold to body contours, or even smell nice.
The bathroom was odd. A very standard, wall mount sink with NO place to easily put accessories. There was a separate vanity off to the side as a nice try to make up for the lack of any counter space - but too far removed from the sink area. The tub had 4 handicapped bars in place but one was placed so that anyone who wanted to take a relaxing bath had to dodge one of the bars placed too close to where your head should be able to rest when laying back.
Was this a 4 star hotel???? really????
There is NO WAY I would recommend or stay at this hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: A LOT!!!!
review.locationRemarks: The main reason I choose this location was because it was sort of close to family I was visiting.

review.title: Double beds again!
review.reviewText: Why is it that some hotels still offer double/full beds as a standard? The average couple do not sllep in a double bed at home and being forced to sleep in one while on vacation is in no way relaxing! A hotel like the Crown Plaza should offer queen beds, as the name is recognized as an upscale hotel chain.
review.negativeRemarks: changing bed size
review.locationRemarks: near airport

review.title: Very disappointing stay.
review.reviewText:
The airport shuttle was 20 minutes late. Pickup time was supposed to be at 10:13 pm. The shuttle arrived at 10:35 pm. I arrived at the hotel at 10:48. When I inquired about getting a bite to eat. I was told that the restaurant closed and room service ended at 11 pm. I had to push the front desk attendant to take me to the restaurant to get something to eat. When I got there with suitcase in tow. I was told that I could not get anything from the kitchen. I asked for a chicken caesar salad and was told that it was an appetizer and not available. I ordered 2 so that it would not be an appetizer. I asked if I could go to my room to put my suitcase away and come back and eat at the bar. I came back to the bar and was told that I had 5 minutes to eat. I requested a drink and was told all that was available was beer. I wolfed down my salad and beer and was pushed out of the restaurant. This was a horrible experience!

When I got back to the room, the room was freezing! The thermostat was broken and I could not calibrate it so the room was comfortable. The sink in the bathroom was clogged. It took a long time for the water to heat up in the shower. The bed was hard as a rock and the pillows were too soft. The noise level was high. I could hear the sound of the traffic going by the hotel. I had an early plane out and only got 3 broken hours of sleep. The room decor was very run down and not inviting at all.

This room was not worth the price.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything can be improved starting with the staff.

review.title: Run down hotel with lots of noice from traffic.
review.reviewText: The pictures on the web side were of a luxury hotel. This hotel was old with no facilities like safe or fridge. We would not class it as a 4 star at all! We were very dissapointed! It was also close to a motorway so we were surrounded by lots of noice from traffic as the windows were not double glazed. A very uncomfortable stay :-(

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: Friendly front desk, prompt airport transfer. Only complain is the room allocated is beside the elevators so I hear everything coming from the elevator shafts through the wall.
review.locationRemarks: great hotel food.

review.title: Airport hotel
review.reviewText: Very convenient to sfo. Room was clean, small, Nicely appointed. Our AC didn't work but the fixed it immediately late on a Tuesday night. Only stay here for airport. I was annoyed the charged for parking.

review.title: Okay...but I'd choose alternate if in the area
review.reviewText: For the price paid, I'd have expected a larger room (one of the smallest I've ever had on an "executive-level" floor) and better soundproofing (so close to SFO.) I will say that room service was prompt and courteous, and the bed was comfortable. Again, though, if I were going to spend $250, I'd gamble it elsewhere rather than returning to this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Room service; meal; convenient to airport
review.negativeRemarks: Bring earplugs for traffic and aircraft noise, as I doubt better soundproofing is feasible or planned.

review.title: I was there for a business trip.
review.reviewText: The staff was the best at this hotel. So kind . helpful. They went beyond my expectations. The room was clean the beds were comfortable . close to everything.

review.title: parking is extra 18/per night
review.reviewText: they do have a wonderful Sea Bass Dinner. cooking perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: pool was small, inside, , its cold and windy outside
review.locationRemarks: kincade restaurant was down the street, wonderful. but very expensive.

review.title: Expect to pay eXtra for parking
review.reviewText: All was good except the fact that we had to pay an extra $18 for parking

managementResponses.response:
Dear Melanie,
Thank you for taking your time to provide us with your feedback. We truly apologize for the noise problem you encountered during your stay with us. Here at the Crowne Plaza we strive to provide a comfortable stay for all our valued guests, and that includes a quiet night’s sleep. That’s why we’re happy to inform you that our hotel renovations are starting this May, and it includes replacing all the guest room windows. In doing this, we hope to provide our guest’s a much more quiet and relaxing stay. We hope you get the chance to come back to our hotel when the renovations are done so that we can make this up to you.

With Warmth and Hospitality,

Brendan Dixon-Beckett
General Manager

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Close to the airport, with free shuttle! But the noise of the airport is awfull, when a plane is crossing, the room shakes! Also ask for a room on the other side of their power radiator, its like you are IN a plane!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

I'm sorry to see that you did not have a satisfactory stay at our hotel. In terms of refrigerators in the rooms, we do have refrigerators available upon requests for no extra charge. If you get the chance to stay with us again, and find yourself needing a refrigerator, just notify the front desk and we'd be more than happy to provide one for you. I'm sorry we weren't able to inform you of this during your stay, however, we hope you get an opportunity to stay with us again and thank you for your feedback.

review.title: The price it's not reasonable.
review.reviewText:
I paid $ 145.00 but no refrigerator. Other Room Facilities terrible.
Also room scented.

Hue`~.

review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle service, old furniture

Air conditioner is lousy

Too noisy

Parking is inconvenient

No free parking for customers and visitors

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you for taking your time to provide us with your feedback. We deeply apologize for the noise problem you encountered during your stay. I'm happy to inform you that our renovations are due to begin in May and our first priority is to replace all the windows which are the main reason for the road noise. I'm sorry for your room not having pen and paper to use. It is our brand standard that there is a pen and paper by the telephone in the room. I will personally follow up on this and figure out what happened. As far as water in rooms, we do not provide them in the room; however, we have complimentary water available at the front desk. If you are ever travelling back to the area, we would love the opportunity to make this up to you.

With Warmth and Hospitality,

Brendan Dixon-Beckett
General Manager

I will definitely follow up on the tiles myself and make sure that it meets our standards. Please let me know if you’re ever back in the area, as I would love the opportunity to make this up to you.

With Warmth and Hospitality,
Brendan Dixon-Beckett
General Manager

not happy about that.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you so much, Cha, for your review of your recent stay with us.

I am very glad tot hear that you received exceptional service from the staff. It is through our guests that we can know when we do a great job and when we need to improve.

You will be happy to know that we are starting our hotel renovations soon, starting with the complete replacement of all hotel windows.

I hope we can invite you back in the future to show you our new improvements.

All the best,

Candace Morales
Front Office Manager

review.title: Okay place.. Won't stay there again.
review.reviewText: Booked the hotel for one night and good thing I did. Upon arrival, the staff was very nice and great service. Got to my floor was it was a flash back to the 60s or something.. The hotel could use some interior cosmetic updates. Then room was ok. Windows were dirty and ruined the view. Bed was to hard for my comfort. Felt like I could have saved a few bucks and gotten the same experience at a lower priced inn or hotel.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you so much for your review, Anne.

I really apologize about the confusion regarding any additional fees for our property. We do our best to ensure that all extra fees are mentioned clearly on our website and any additional 3rd party websites. I did verify that this information is available to ensure that this confusion does not happen' in the future. We also have parking staff throughout the day that monitors the property and lot, as well as security at night to ensure that our guest vehicles are safe.

We do provide complimentary wireless internet to all of our IHG Rewards guests and make sure that our parking fees are competitive with the surrounding area hotels.

We will be going through renovations soon, including the replacement of all our hotel windows.

I hope we can invite you back in the future to show you our new improvements once our renovations are completed.

With warmth and hospitality,

Candace Morales
Front Office Manager

review.title: Hidden fees abound.
review.reviewText: The website said that the rooms have wifi, but neglected to mention that they charge you per day. The parking cost was a surprise, too, since no mention was made of it. It cost $18.00 overnight, but you just parked in the open lot where no security measures seemed to be taken to protect your car. Hotel staff seemed to think that these fees were just 'business as usual,' but I've stayed in Airport hotels (actually, I stayed in one just a couple of doors down from this one three days earlier than this visit) and the wifi was complementary, as was parking. The dining facility was less pretentious, too. I was not traveling for business, so I found the hotel 'off-putting.' Won't go there again.

review.title: I will never use Expedia to book a hotel again
review.reviewText: I was scheduled for a trip to California from February 13 through the 18th. I booked two rooms at the Crowne Plaza for Monday night. On Thursday my flights were cancelled due to snow in Maryland. All flights were cancelled and we couldn't get out of town until Saturday afternoon. The wedding was Saturday at 6:00. Needless to say, we couldn't get to California. We called the Hotel on Thursday when we knew we would not be able to get a flight. We tried all three airports, and even an airport in Pittsburgh to try to get out of town. We talked to the Hotel and we talked to Expedia. They would not refund our money, even though they had plenty of time to rebook those rooms with someone else. Expedia blames the hotel, the hotel would not refund our money. This situation was totally out of our control because of the weather yet the hotel was unsympathetic. I will never stay at a Crowne Plaza, nor will I use Expedia to book a room.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your review, Greg.

I am very sorry you left here with a less than satisfactory experience with us. I would like to take this moment to address some of your concerns as we take our guest experiences very seriously.

I do understand your concerns about the conditions of the hotel and guest rooms. We are currently finalizing our plans for our hotel renovation, part of which is replacing all the windows, which is set to be completed early this year.

The fire alarm was a result of another guest smoking on their floor and setting off our fire alarm. As the safety and security of our guests is of the utmost important, we do not silence the alarm until the fire department ensures that there is no danger. I really apologize that you had to experience this due to the inconsideration of another.

Because of the cancellation of flights all over the country, we did experience a higher than average amount of guests needing to use our shuttle to and from the airport. However, anytime we do not have enough space on the shuttle, we always provide cabs to the airport and make sure to pay for the transportation for those guests. I do see that we had to call several cabs on the morning of the 3rd to accommodate for the extra bodies. The staff should have made you aware of this when they saw that we had more passengers than our capacity and made arrangements earlier and I am very sorry that we failed you. I will ensure that the staff is made aware of the situation and the importance of preparing ahead of time when they see a long line of passengers waiting for the shuttle.

We definitely experienced an influx of passengers above our normal expectations due to the changes in weather throughout the country, as well as extra bookings through the airlines from grounded flights. We do our best to ensure that all of our guests are taken care of to the best of our abilities and I am very sorry that you were inconvenienced during this time and we did not do our best to ensure your stay was wonderful.

If there is anything we can do to make up for this experience, please let us know.

All the best,

Candace Morales
Front Office Manager

review.title: Bad experience
review.reviewText:
Our family of 5 stayed at the Crowne Plaza two times during a Bay Area vacation (Dec 27 for 1 night, Jan 1 for 2 nights), booked through expedia.

Location is OK (~2 miles from SFO), rooms were OK but a bit tired, window view was of a freeway and an HVAC unit, restaurant was pretty good. Overall, the facility is mediocre and in need of renovation (feels a bit like the set of Mad Men). But, it's an airport hotel, so our expectations were minimal (decent night's sleep with minimal hassle, reliable airport transportation). Unfortunately, those minimal expectations were not met.

Fire alarm at 2 AM the first night (false alarm); long lines at check-in both times; first set of room keys didn't work (we were not the only unfortunate guests), and no apparent bellman or luggage help at all.

But the most egregious experience occurred on the morning we left for the airport. Shuttle van pulled up on time (7 AM), but the driver had another stop to make (Holiday Inn down the road), and therefore kept half the bus empty, telling about 15 people (airline personnel, tourists with luggage, families) that they would need to wait another 30 minutes. Shouting, shoving, profanities, all of which could have been avoided with more responsible management.

There's a big sign at the front desk that says "This Crowne Plaza hotel is managed by Rim Hospitality". An oxymoron, since it was so badly mismanaged, and was about the most inhospitable hotel experience ever.

review.locationRemarks: "Close" to the airport but not close enough to walk (which some people needed to do).

review.title: Spent six days here
review.reviewText: I just spent six days staying at this hotel while organizing the memorial service for my mom and the sale of her house. Obviously, it was a complex and stressful time for our family, but we found the staff amazingly helpful and friendly during the entire stay. This is a no-frills kind of business hotel, with single pane windows adjacent to a major freeway and a loud HVAC system. They do provide some nice aromatherapy supplies, presumably to try to compensate for the noise factor. We stayed on the Executive Floor, which had a modest but comfortable lounge with TV's, drinks and a place to gather. The buffet breakfast each morning was OK, though again, the staff was terrific.

The bed was comfy and had nice pillows.The room needed more sound proofing - I could hear all the planes . Compilmentary breakfast would be nice.

review.title: Easy access to the City and South Bay
review.reviewText:
The Crowne Plaza hotel is right off the freeway in Burlingame near SFO. It's a nice hotel and the price we got from Expedia made it great. Parking overnight is $18 per day and that's not too bad.

Had two double beds and the view was okay since it was just basically the closest thing Californians get to swampland but we were fortunate to have a 7th floor as the 9 and 10 are for suites and other amenities.

The only issue I had with the hotel is that it didn't have a microwave, coffee machine and refrigerator. Otherwise it was a pleasing stay. I would recommend it but look for a deal through Expedia. The price we paid without the parking was under $100 so that was great
review.positiveRemarks: Easy access to the freeway and south of the City and north of the area we were exploring San Mateo, Cupertino and Santa Clara.
review.negativeRemarks: Have a coffee machine, refrigerator and microwave or at least two of the three appliances
review.locationRemarks: Being in Burlingame, you're only minutes away from some of the best ethnic cuisine in the world, Chinese, Japanese, Indian, you name it and sights!

review.title: Big Disappointment for the Price!
review.reviewText: Carpet had a big stain at the foot of bed. One wall had three black marks on it. Two of the four glass drinking glasses were dirty! The drapes over the windows had food or something on it. Needless to say I will not be staying at a Crowne Plaza every again!
review.positiveRemarks: The Lobby was nice. Also the bathroom was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff needs to do a better job inspecting the rooms before they are rented out!

review.negativeRemarks: I had prepaid the bill as noted on arrival, yet the hotel put several charges on my debit card which they have now agreed to remove. A real hassle.

Was only there for a short time. arrived late and left early to catch a flight. I could have went back down and changed rooms, but was tired but where my room was located there was a lot of traffic noise so I didn't get a lot of sleep. Would have thought they would place me in a better location knowing that I was arriving late and leaving early.

review.reviewText: I'm usually not one to complain but of all the places I've traveled to this year, this hotel has to be the worst. Besides the tiny matchbox of a room, it smelled of mold when I entered, the bathroom door wouldn't lock, and the bathroom wasn't very sanitary. I had such a pleasant stay at the Crowne Plaza in St. Louis; dare I say that the Crowne in San Francisco was terrible. If it were not for the superior customer service I received from the staff, I would have checked out immediately. My coworker was in the Rodeway Inn 10 miles away and as a 1 star hotel it was better than the Crowne.

review.reviewText: we enjoyed our stay had a good time and love the comfort and cleaniness of the hotel.

I pre-paid online for two rooms for two nights that were non-cancellable and non-refundable. But when we arrived at the hotel around 12:30am, the front desk staff said our rooms were not available! They oversold. We reluctantly agreed to their putting us in another hotel that was several minutes away. We found it unreasonable however that they could only put us there for the first night and require us to come back to their hotel in the second night. Since we have a pretty tight meeting schedule, we would not have the time to do so. They eventually agreed to cancel the second night and refund the related room charge through Expedia. We ended up paying a bit more staying in the other hotel for both nights.

review.reviewText:
The room decor was average. The room was clean. Lacked adequate electrical outlets, hair dryer and good quality TV.

In the 21st century a hotel guest should NOT HAVE TO PAY EXTRA FOR INTERNET ACCESS. I will not stay at this hotel again because of this problem - a show stopper.

In a major city I would expect to pay for parking but not at a suburban location with tons of available space. The $18 charge for parking at this location was offensive. Many of the competing hotels on the same street did not charge for parking. Another show stopper.

I will avoid Crown Plaza hotels in the future because of these problems.
review.negativeRemarks: See above: Internet access, TV quality, parking fees, electrical outlets, hair dryer..... I could go on.

review.title: A reasonably priced hotel not far from the airport
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 1 night on a quick stopover. From the SFO terminals a free shuttle bus comes by every 1/2 an hour to take you to the hotel. The hotel itself is well appointed and feels quite modern. The rooms are spacious, quiet and comfortable with a coffee maker in the room. Crowne Plaza provide you with their 'relaxation kit' which consists of some nice touches to soothe your weary body after a hard days travel. I can't say that I am much into that sort of thing but it was a nice gesture! Not too far from the hotel (within walking distance) is the Burlingame Broadway on which you will find quite a large number of restaurants and cafe's if you are keen to get meals away from the hotel. Over all it's a very nice place to stay at a very reasonable cost. If you don't have transport it isn't a problem as you can get the free shuttle to the airport and then it's just a quick ride on the BART train into San Francisco proper.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport. Reasonably priced. Well appointed rooms. Great food options close by.
review.locationRemarks: Great food options on the Burlingame Broadway (walking distance). Check out the Broadway Grill for a great steak.

review.reviewText: Planned a night at the Crowne Plaza after a late arrival at SFO. Everything was just fine and I made an early exit to a downtown SF vacation. Not much to say except I did not want to pay a luxury rate for a night in which I could not enjoy the full SF experience.

review.title: close to airport
review.reviewText:
service desk .. prompt and efficient info.
All good.
review.positiveRemarks: prompt front desk... and check-in ... provided all shuttle info, including printed schedule room well laid out, comfortable furniture, very clean,
review.negativeRemarks: all ok
review.locationRemarks: we were there for a quick overnight and early flight, don't know.

review.title: Good location for many restaurants
review.reviewText: Good experience-check in and check out went quickly and room was not a disappointment
review.positiveRemarks: We needed something priced moderately and located close to freeway and Kincaid's Restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Good location for the airport, Candlestick and lots of good restaurants

managementResponses.response: Thank you for letting us know about your recent stay with us. I am very sorry you had the challenges you experienced with our shuttle service. I am sharing your comments with our shuttle provider so that they can ensure we best serve our guests. I am very sorry that the shuttle was late and you had to pay for a cab from the airport. I am more than happy to cover the cost of that ride for you as we want to make sure that our guests do not have to be inconvenienced from the shuttle service. I apologize the accomodations were less than what you expected, but I hope we can invite you back in the future. We are intending to start renovations to the hotel in November of 2013, and plan to finish sometime in 2014. I would love for you to see our new look. Thank you again for taking the time to let us know where we can improve.

review.title: pricey for accommodations
review.reviewText: Poor shuttle svc from a/p. Ride on shuttle was included in price of room. Waited 30 mins for shuttle at a/p; then it zoomed by w/out stopping. Had to take & pay for cab ride to hotel. Hotel accommodations were doable for the very short period that I stayed there. But, I definitely did not want to stay there longer than I had too.
review.negativeRemarks: I feel as though the hotel was pretty pricey for the accommodations. Poor shuttle svc from a/p; waited 30 mins, then shuttle zoomed by didn't stop.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your comments for your recent stay. I am very sorry that the room you were first checked in to was not clean. I will make sure this is passed on to our housekeeping department so they can ensure they are tracking our clean and dirty rooms appropriately. I also noticed that you were disappointed about the lack of areas to go to around the hotel. While there is not much directly at the property area, there is a walking area to the right of the hotel with a path that is very scenic for jogging, running, walking, and biking. There is also a pedestrian pathway that can take you down to Broadway with some restaurants, and the Burlingame trolley that can take you to downtown Burlingame with a large selection of restaurants and shopping, which runs free of charge. I apologize that our staff did not inform you of this during your stay. I will make sure that the front desk staff is retrained on the familiarity of the area to better serve our guests.

review.title: Hotel needs updating.
review.reviewText: First room was not clean so we were moved to a new room.
review.negativeRemarks: Updating Hotel
review.locationRemarks: Not much within walking distance.

review.title: Close to Airport
review.reviewText: I wqas only there for a few hours. I needed a place to rest before and after dropping off my grand daughter. I wish I did not have to spend as much but it was worth haaving a clean nice place to rest my head.

review.title: Very close to the airport and good shuttle bus
review.reviewText: Very comfortable hotel nice evening meal and breakfast perfect for our requirements
review.negativeRemarks: bedrooms in need of decoration
review.locationRemarks: Didn't try anything as only stayed for one night

review.title: Just a few hours to hang out before flight
review.reviewText: This was a very good choice for a very early departure from SFO. The biggest problem was the shuttle - too many people, too many bags. I was a lucky one to be able to get on - many were not! If this service is offered, it should be bigger buses or more of them. I assume many use this hotel as a base for traveling in and out of SFO so the location is good but the shuttles are inadequate (although the drivers were helpful and polite!)

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport and convenient to BART
review.reviewText:
Our room was very comfortable and clean. The hotel was 3 minutes by free shuttle to the airport where the BART station is located. It's also located along the bay which gave us excellent plane spotting as the planes came into land.

The food in the restaurant was delicious and always served fresh and hot.
Altogether, a very enjoyable experience!
review.positiveRemarks: Mostly, the convenience of getting into San Francisco, as well as the comfort and cleanliness of the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that I can think of.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to airport BART station and for plane spotting. Nothing else nearby.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your review from your recent stay. We are currently in the process of finalizing our hotel and guest room renovation, scheduled to be completed by 2014. I hope we can invite you back in the future to see the improvements we have made. Thank you again.

Candace Morales
Front Office Manager

review.title: hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: that's the hotel you book only 'cause is close to the airport and you have to sleep only few hours.
review.negativeRemarks: hotel needs a make up
review.locationRemarks: nothing all around

review.title: Great hotel for lay off
review.reviewText: We found this hotel extremely convenient for our one day lay off. It was easy to get there due to the free shuttle service, and even though we arrived earlier than the check in time, they gave us our room so we could rest after a long flight. The blackout curtains were great!
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the airport, so it was very comfortable for what we needed.

review.title: its ok for the money
review.reviewText: ok for the money yard needs cleaning. A little noisey
review.negativeRemarks: parking cost should be Free
review.locationRemarks: good

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your comments, Mecaju. I am sorry that the shuttle took longer than expected. The shuttle drivers go between three hotels and sometimes it can take them a bit longer than the 30 minutes between runs before they arrive. I really apologize for the wait and would be happy to get a cab for you in the future if this happens again. I will definitely pass on your comments regarding the cost of the buffet to our restaurant management. Thank you again for your review and we hope to see you in the future.

Candace Morales
Front Office Manager

review.title: Family Trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Good experience in general. We had to wait quite a bit of time at the airport before the first hotel shuttle showed up, we were at the airport around 10:00 PM. We had enough time to see the other hotels' shuttle twice before our shuttle finally showed up, I'd say it took 35-40 minutes. The ride from the airport to the hotel is only approx. 10 minutes The breakfast buffet is fine but way too expensive (15$ for adults), it not worth that.
review.negativeRemarks: - Lower the price of the breakfast buffet or make it a complimentary breakfast.

review.title: i will not go here again
review.reviewText:
For the price, I expected a lot better. Besides being expensive in the first place:
- they charged for parking even though the lot was 70% empty
- they charged over $40 for breakfast for 2 people
- the beds were low quality
review.positiveRemarks: Was close to airport but not too close
review.negativeRemarks: better beds, no parking fees, cheaper breakfast!

review.title: I have never stayed in a worse hotel!!!!!
review.reviewText: I have never stayed in a worse hotel. Do not stay here with children. We only stayed here because we had a 6 am flight out of SFO and thought that this would be convenient and that they have a early morning shuttle to the airport. Trust me it is better to stay in downtown San Francisco and take a cab! We were the first ones in line at 345 am for a shuttle to the airport and the driver of the hotel shuttle, MIKE, refused to let us on with children and luggage. Children are not welcome on the shuttle and drivers pick and choose who they are willing to take. They let all the passengers on first and when they got to us they said, sorry there is no more room. Children are unwelcome and the staff makes it known. The shuttle drive made us miss our flight. The staff is rude and refuses to help. I asked to speak to a manager and they have up to this point been unresponsive. Do not stay at this hotel. Try the hilton, double tree, hyatt.....Just a warning.
review.negativeRemarks: Fire the staff and managment and shuttle service!

review.title: Great staff!
review.reviewText: Staff incredibly helpful, especially CJ at the front desk. Made every effort possible to make our stay as perfect as possible after an initial,booking problem through Expedia, and they totally rectified the situation. Would stay here again. Thanks Crowne Plaza Burlingame!

review.title: Nice place although not very new.
review.reviewText: I This hotel was nice enough. It wasn't new but was basically comfortable. I couldn't get the temperature in the room low enough to be really comfortable but keeping the fan on all night helped.
review.positiveRemarks: It was very convenient to the airport. The staff was kind enough to grant an extension since I wasn't able to check in until around 8:30 a.m.
review.negativeRemarks: A bottle of water in the room would have been appreciated.
review.locationRemarks: I liked the proximity to the airport but did not have time to check out any place else.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your comments, George. I really apologize for the experience you had with us at the hotel. We are currently in the process of finishing up the plans for our hotel renovation which we intend to start in November and have completed in 2014. This includes all guest rooms, public areas, as well as the hotel windows to reduce noise from the freeway. I am also sharing your comments about breakfast with our restaurant staff to see what we can do to improve the breakfast buffet. I hope we can invite you back in the future to show you our improvements.

Candace Morales
Front Office Manager

review.title: Aging Crown Plaza Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel needs a refurbishing. Its inside offers a feeling of being worn. It is most likely a transit hotel for the close by San Francisco Airport. It is functional, it is clean, but I would expect nicer Hotel from a Crown Plaza. Service from Hotel Staff is o.k. My family has eaten breakfast twice in the hotel. The breakfast buffet is o.k. There is nothing distinguishable from the breakfast that every hotel offers. There is an exercise room and an inside pool. The pool is not supervised but it is busy with children in the Evening. Some of the guests and their children at the pool are out of control, jumping without regards to the other guests. It worked for us to visit San Francisco, the price was moderate.

review.title: awesome service
review.reviewText: the staff is really nice. it's a old hotel but everything is pretty clean.

review.title: Nice hotel, convenient to the airport
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. There was a mix up with my room and they upgraded me to the executive level and offered complimentary wi-fi for the confusion. My only complaint would be with parking. $18/day is a little intense.
review.negativeRemarks: Price of parking is a little steep

review.title: Great Location near airport
review.reviewText: Late Flight but thanks to the shuttle that runs till 1 am is no problem. Rented a car from Hertz in Burlingame the next day which is a money saver. Did not have to pay for all the travel taxes associted renting a car at the airport. Since it was close Hertz picked me up and dropped me off allowed me to save $250 over 9 days. I also did not have to pay $18 dollars daily fee for the hotel parking. In addition, it is a short walk to do Burlingame's main street where you can get a bite to eat.
review.negativeRemarks: Free parking if applicable

review.title: Good hotel next to the airport.
review.reviewText: Great breakfast buffet and nice updated rooms. The thermostat was not working right but they promptly fixed it.

review.title: Stay
review.reviewText: When we got to the hotel we had to ask them to change our sheets because we found boogers on them. We were happy to get our room earlier then expected but it would've been nice if it was actually cleaned with more care.
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: there's plenty of restaurants around the hotel

review.title: Crown of the SF airport
review.reviewText: It is not convinent to stay in this hotel except to watch the landing of the airplane and the suttle bus to the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: the fitness room is not bad.
review.negativeRemarks: In such a inconvienent place they should provide free internet and parking. The TV channel should be much clear.
review.locationRemarks: to watch the plane landing and walk the dog only.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: Great price on Expedia. I wouldn't be able to stay here without a discounted price. High end hotel, easy to get to airport. Bed was one of those memory foam beds, which I do not like.

review.title: The room was dirty and small
review.reviewText: The bed was uncomfortable but the worst is that there was pubic hair in the bed. Gross. Slept on top of the covers, which was cold. Glad we were only there for a few hours while waiting for an early morning flight.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: If you are going to travel this hotel is a good option,It´s near the airport, the price is good, the hotel is not bad,,, I recommend this hotel only if you are going to travel
review.locationRemarks: The airport SFO

review.title: nice hotel - clean and convenient
review.reviewText: my experience was very good. check in was very quick and easy. the room was clean and comfortable, and exactly what I needed ahead of an early flight the next morning. Thanks for the excellent experience!
review.positiveRemarks: the convenience, cleanliness, and newness of hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: no. this satisfied the need I had for convenient accommodations the night before an early flight.
review.locationRemarks: the principal reason for my stay was to get to the airport early the next day. the shuttle service helped very much with this.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you so much for your comments, Vicki. I am very sorry that you had such a negative experience with us during your stay. I have forwarded your comments regarding the elevators to our engineering staff so they can have them inspected and ensure they are working properly for the safety of our guests. I also forwarded your comments about the smell of the room to see what we can do to provide a better experience for our guests.

I hope we can invite you back to show you our improvements.

All the best,
Candace Morales
Front Office Manager

review.title: Nice to airport but too close to freeway, noisy.
review.reviewText: We had good experiences with crown plaza hotels in other locations. That is the main reason we made reservation for this trip. But we were disappointed a little. The elevators needed services. Actually one of them was almost stopped on 6th floor and very noisy. It was very frightening. And in the room, especially the bathroom, smelled something like dust, I cannot explain exactly. The maid was very nice.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco city sightseeing. Burlingame shopping center on Burlingame blvd. Visit Yosemite or napa valley Bay cruises Colleges like UC Berkeley

review.title: Nice Hotel!
review.reviewText: Stay there for 2nights and everything went ok. Room is clean but a little dated.
review.negativeRemarks: Restroom

review.title: Near the airport
review.reviewText: Any problems I had where taken care of immediately. My grandkids thought the fruit flavored water in the lobby was awesome. They thought the cucumber water was a bit unusual. Lol
review.positiveRemarks: The staff - the excellent breakfast buffet
review.negativeRemarks: Pool area and pool could use some tlc.
review.locationRemarks: Advantage rent a car a block away and there is a free advantage shuttle directly from airport so drop off was easy.

review.title: Great place.
review.reviewText: Awsome place, great restaurant. Recommended. I would stay here again.

review.title: good enough
review.reviewText: everything is available with reseonable price. The room was clean and quiete enough.
review.positiveRemarks: good location, and various facilities including swimming pool, spa. Those are small, but acceptable.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff looks unfamilar enough.
review.locationRemarks: Near beach, airport, and local pubs.

review.title: Close to the airport.
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to the airport and an easy drive to downtown San Francisco. For the price, the accommodations and service were OK, pretty much what I would have expected. The main downside was the traffic noise. The hotel sits on US 101 and the traffic is constant through the night and permeates the rooms. We were on the 5th floor, nowhere near high enough to escape it. Given the high prices of decent hotel rooms in the San Francisco area, I would have hoped they could make the rooms a little more quiet. Additional fees for internet and parking, standard I know but still seems unreasonable given what your are paying. We got one of Expedia's "mystery hotel" deals, which only knocked $20 off the price we would have paid. Restaurant on the premises with a full buffet breakfast for $15. Across the highway, however, is Burlingame with lots of great restaurants to chose from. Next time we'll look elsewhere. Not terrible but not great.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport.
review.reviewText: The beds were very comfortable and the restaurant staff was very friendly and generous.
review.negativeRemarks: One more bathmat.
review.locationRemarks: Airport

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Shuttle service from airport. Check-in was quick and easy. Restaurant on site - although I did not visit it. Shuttle back to airport started nice and early. They saw that there was going to be more people going to the airport that the one shuttle would hold so they called for backup. Great job and front desk staff for seeing that.

review.title: decent enough
review.reviewText:
hotel was clean, shuttle was on time, beds were comfortable.
But be sure to ask for a room away from the free way! the concierage level was nothing special. it's a little detail, but the hotel doesn't stock hotel tea bags. i thought that was strange.

review.title: Free airport shuttle.
review.reviewText: Waiting for an airport shuttle. The first one was full. We waited for the next one and made sure to be right up front when the shuttle got there. There were a bunch of airline people that stayed at the hotel and the rules for the free shuttle states that the airline people have priority. After the airline people were on, the driver said he could only take eight people, luckily we were right up front. We made it to our flight, but if we had to wait for another shuttle or called a taxi, we might not have made it. What good is a free shuttle if you miss your flight and I hated being pushy to get the shuttle...I felt very rude and that is not me.

review.title: good choice for overnight layover
review.reviewText: I was traveling from Frankfurt to Hawaii, and had a forced overnight layover. I wanted a good sleep with reliable shuttle service. This place is close to the airport, and they provided an airport shuttle schedule with frequent trips (every 25 minutes, if i remember correctly). It stops also at the Vagabond, so if you are price sensitive, it may be a better choice.

review.title: Only thing going for it is proximity to SFO
review.reviewText: Dirty, stained carpets in both rooms. Additional charge for Internet access.

review.title: Freeway noise
review.reviewText:
FreeaAy noise
Foul smell in room
Tried to charge for breakfast we did not order

review.title: Good hotel overall!!
review.reviewText: Pleasing hotel for a stay overnight. A bit far from downtown.
review.positiveRemarks: Pleasing staff, good gym and pool.
review.negativeRemarks: Keep up good work, no complaints.
review.locationRemarks: Go Burlingame for dinner and ice cream. Good place for shopping as well.

review.title: Dreadful
review.reviewText: Hotel staff particularly in the restaurant was very rude.i made a complaint at front desk but i am not sure if they will take any action against the staff so for me it was a bad experience staying there so thats why i gave it dreadful

review.title: Great for people!
review.reviewText:
Great Hotel, the only reason I give it a 4 is because of the $36 I had to pay for only 2 days to park there. They definitely do their best to hide the fact that they will even charge you. Then lay it on you at check out. Although it is an airport hotel so I assume most visitors wont be driving and parking there.

On a plus note, staying there during the week with my girlfriend was a great experience. Many of the other visitors were there on business so it felt like we had the whole hotel to ourselves, pool, hot tub, bar... definitely added to the relaxing atmosphere.

Also, even though this hotel is near the airport and major freeway, they were not audible. The sound of the room fan/AC was louder than any other noises outside the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking Fees.
review.locationRemarks: Close enough to San Francisco, and plenty of other services.

review.title: One more number for business of this hotel.....
review.reviewText: I have stayed in some hotels in San Francisco, Miami and Southern California, but in this one in special I was surprised that the room didn't have even a "complementary" bottle water... I had to pay to get a parking space around the property, and the gentleman who hosted me on the front desk had a kind of "robot behavior"... Sorry about my honesty, but I felt like a one more number for the hotel business..... Definitely I wouldn't recommend this hotel for anyone.....
review.locationRemarks: Location was great, not the hotel....

review.title: 1st stay was great
review.reviewText:
Hotel ran out of hot water early Sunday morning. Only 2 toast selections visible in the buffet.
Only 2 problems that came to mind.
review.negativeRemarks: Highway so close. I know, but it is the only thing that woke me up in the morning
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: Good for business travelers
review.reviewText: Clean hotel. Only drawback is its right next to the highway so its a little noisy.

review.title: I had a wonderful stay here.
review.reviewText: The staff were friendly and helpful, and went out of their way to make sure I had everything I needed. The room was comfortable and spacious, and I enjoyed my stay there very, very much.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were all beyond helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: It's a little distressed and loud. But after all, it IS next to an airport!
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to the airport.

review.title: A very pleasant and relaxing stay
review.reviewText: Staying in the hotel was very comfortable and relaxing Thank you ...
review.positiveRemarks: having hair dryer and iron available in the room and also the comfortable bed was awesome
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco, CA

review.title: Great hotel near airport
review.reviewText: Clean (very important), convenient, friendly, good service........
review.negativeRemarks: No nearby eating choices except the hotel's cafe (which was good)
review.locationRemarks: Near airport

review.title: Easy Access!
review.reviewText: Great location near SFO airport and the restaurants in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Closing @ 11 on a FRIDAY? What's up with that? Keep the bar open till midnight. You have a captive crowd!

review.title: Good value near SFO
review.reviewText: Good food in the lounge--try the "fish tacos" (on lettuce, not tortillas).
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent value in these days of skyrocketing hotel rates.
review.negativeRemarks: Quirky elevators. Would have appreciated a softer pillow.
review.locationRemarks: Burbank's old downtown, about a ten minute walk, is a good surprise. Access to the Bay trail is close-by. Fast, reliable shuttles to SFO.

review.title: Crowne Plaza SFO
review.reviewText: For a quick stopover before/after a flight, this hotel is fine, but I wouldn't recommend it for a long-term stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff at the hotel was excellent. Susie at the front desk was great!
review.negativeRemarks: Carpets could be cleaner, windows could better insulate against noise. Our pillow top had a blood stain on it, which we didn't see until we woke up.

review.title: Would not stay here again
review.reviewText:
Freeway way too close to the hotel, keep me up all night.
Charge 18.00 for Parking
No fan/vent in the bathroom.
They did not leave coffee setup for our third morning.
Airconditioner system pointed directly at the desk, with what looked like a make shift metal air direction strip.
Booked through Expedia - NO CANCELLATION
review.negativeRemarks: See about
review.locationRemarks: too close to the freeway

review.title: Comfortable basics
review.reviewText: The best things about this hotel were the friendly staff and the cleanliness of the rooms. There is a nice breakfast buffet every day that runs about $14.00 per person. Parking and Internet are extra which is true for most of the San Francisco hotels. There are restaurants out of the hotel which are within walking distance. Shuttles run between the hotel and the airport. There is an exercise room, pool, and barber shop on the main level. All in all an nice place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Having to pay extra for the WiFi and parking.
review.locationRemarks: The location is south of San Francisco Airport. It is near freeways and convenient to the city.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: It is worn out and in need of repair and redecorating.
review.negativeRemarks: condition of hotel
review.locationRemarks: near SFO

review.title: Tired
review.reviewText: Hotel is tired and needs a major refurbishment. The rooms are small by US standards. High charges for Parking and Internet. There is free Wifi at MacDonalds/Starbucks etc!!
review.negativeRemarks: old fashioned carpet
review.locationRemarks: Noisy

review.title: Nice hotel -- great bed, clean room, nice decor
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and well kept. The room was very nice. A little small but very comfortable. The hotel and room were decorated nicely.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy access to freeway. Close to city. Restaurants nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size was small although I don't know if you have a variety of sizes and we got a smaller one.

review.title: Great view
review.reviewText: Great view, excellent room and bed, bathroom was ok. Rip off on parking no free parking, $40 extra for the parking. So you might save on the room but with that kind of expense on the parking you might as well get a higher priced hotel.

review.title: Out Dates and Uncomfortable
review.reviewText: I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone! The hotel is horribly out dated! The rooms are stuffed with old furniture and the beds felt like you were sleeping on 1970 mattresses! On top of one of the WORST NIGHTS of sleep I have had in a while.. The hotels shuttle to the airport was not on time... We almost missed our flight because the shuttle showed up late. The only good experience was the staff was pleasant. I was horribly disappointed and will never again book this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: every square inch of the hotel.. the furniture.. the beds, the bathrooms

review.title: Nice place, friendly staff.
review.reviewText: We didn't stay long, but the hotel is very convenient to the airport, which is what we needed. The staff is friendly, and the restaurant was excellent.

review.title: Would not recommend.
review.reviewText: Front desk staff were unfriendly and grumpy. I was disappointed with the old appearance of the room and the bed was not comfortable. I expected more from a 3.5 rating hotel. Also the $18.00/day parking fee was a bit overpriced.
review.positiveRemarks: The quality of the soap/shampoo products. Also the welcome pack of aromatherapy samples.

review.title: Great Stay, minus the sneezing
review.reviewText: Great service and friendly staff. The room was nice and the bed was very comfortable. I slept like a baby, except for sneezing constantly from the dusty room. Two negatives: eating in the hotel is very expensive and I could see a few dust webs hanging from the ceiling of my room. Other than that, I don't have any complaints and would likely stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: dust
review.locationRemarks: easy to get to via shuttle

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean, happy hour was nice. Free trolly ride into the downtown area was a great perk!

review.title: good times for all
review.reviewText: head a great time in the pool and jacuzzi with the family. we even got a work out in at the gym. breakfast was great your pay 10 buck for a full buffet breakfast and the 10 covered everyone in our rooms. Staff was so nice when we went out in the evening they gave us hot spots.
review.positiveRemarks: we were 4 familes. staff made sure we were all together and met our special request of cribs in the rooms.

review.title: Nice pleasent hotel for a short stay
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was nice. I liked the scenery and the overall feel that it gave me. The staff aided me in anything that I needed and provided me with good service. Only one issue I had was that I had to call many times for my tray to be picked up and no one showed up. Other than that I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. I'd go again if the oppurtunity came by.

review.title: Great hotel for a family!
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were great! The kids enjoyed the pool.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms and bed was great.
review.negativeRemarks: The room service pizza I ordered was disgusting!
review.locationRemarks: The location was great to use the free airport shuttle

review.title: Front Desk
review.reviewText: The front desk clerk was very miserable and not friendly whatsoever.

review.title: Decent hotel with good Restaurant!
review.reviewText: Loved the Hotel Restaurant and its service.Good Place to spend a night to catch a flight..Food was pleasant surprise..
review.locationRemarks: Convenient from Airport

review.title: Take or rent a car if you're staying here.
review.reviewText:
It's too far from the city. Getting back to it late at night is very expensive since public transportation stops by midnight and cab fare from the city is over $100.

Would be fine if you have your own car. The hotel, itself, is fine.
review.negativeRemarks: Too far from the city
review.locationRemarks: No public transportation late at night.

review.title: I won't go back there
review.reviewText: When we arrived the clerks were not friendly and there were a handful of irate people in the lobby who were having issues checking in. The main clerk was telling the woman in front of me in line to step aside because he couldn't help her. When it was my turn I learned that parking would be $18 per day, which is ridiculous because they have a huge parking lot. When we got into our room it was very small and crowded, the bed wasn't very comfortable, the bathroom had mould spots on the ceiling. The included breakfast was hardly worth eating, the eggs were slimy and the French toast hardly cooked. Some of the fruit was good. Worst coffee I've ever had. The pool was nice but very small, the hot tub had a grimy ring around it and is very small. I won't stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Room, hot tub, parking fees

review.title: Great Hotel less than 1 mile from Airport
review.reviewText: overnight stay to catch an early flight. Great room, timely shuttle to the airport

review.title: fair for airport proximity
review.reviewText: Near airport - shuttle service only every 1/2 hour and was not on schedule

review.title: DIRTY & DATED
review.reviewText: DIRTY, DATED and plenty of highway noise..that sums it up.

review.title: Making things even better.
review.reviewText:
The staff were very courteous and helpful. There are however, some areas where service could be greatly improved:

1. Airport pick-up service: The hotel could post on their website a timetable for shuttle vans from and to San Francisco International Airport. By doing so, many travelers would have a better idea about when to wait for the bus, particularly at the airport.

2. Internet connection: The hotel could print a one-page illustrated pamphlet explaining how to connect to the internet. This would help foreign travelers in particular.

3. Restaurant staff: Many weary travelers would certainly appreciate if there were more servers at the restaurant, in particular during the evening hours. Many customers have to wait for a long time until they get service, and this is due to the fact that there were only three people working at a time when there were over fifty customers.

Overall, this is a very good hotel. Staffing and establishing more effective ways of communicating with customers would greatly improve the quality of the service and bring back many customers.

Thank you.

review.title: High prices in a low rent package and location.
review.reviewText:
This is a Holiday Inn masquerading as a Crown Plaza (I know they are the same owners). It's a 2 star hotel trying to pass itself off as a 4 star. The hotel is right next to the freeway. The rooms are noisy and they know it; each room has earplugs in the nightstand. The pool was closed when I was there without notice as was the jacuzzi. No apology, no credit, just tough luck. sorry.

They rip you off for parking at 18.00 while the Hyatt down the street is much nicer and has free parking. Similarly, be prepared to pay thru the nose if you left something at home or it was not in your room. Most 4 star hotels have Q-tips, good soap, conditioner, cotton balls, shoe mitts etc... This had bars of soap that were nothing by the end of my shower, shampoo that was good for 2 uses and no q-tips or anything else. When I went to the front desk to ask about getting a couple of Q-tips, they said that they did not have anything and I would have to wait till the gift shop opened. That of course, did me no good at 7 am. When I checked in the afternoon, the gift shop wanted $3.95 for a package of 20 Q-tips. Needless to say, I did without the next morning since I was returning home.

I asked for a handicapped accessible room and got their version of one. They are on the first floor facing the (closed) pool and across from some meeting rooms. All I can say is thank god I was not in a wheelchair. The room not really comfortably accessible. The heater was noisy, I guess to cover up the freeway roar.
review.negativeRemarks: The cramped room with the noise of the freeway to interrupt your sleep

review.title: This place is in the "AVOID" column
review.reviewText: The hotel gets a big fat Zero for the fact that an unexpected $36 parking fee was not posted and the tickets were not refundable. The surprised charge took the great deal from a savings to an overcharge of $36. And, I had changed hotels to get a better posted pricing. It is too bad that the hotel itself will never see this message to all prospective hotel clients. YOU WILL BE CHARGED $18 PER NIGHT PARKING FEE. STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL. There are no less than 3 major hotels withing a couple of miles that have free parking, free breakfast and bigger rooms. The rooms are very small, the hotel is aged and shows it, and there is no free continental breakfast. The Crown Royal is a throwback to yesteryear. The entire chain will never again see my business.

Room and hotel generally was clean and comfortable.

Yes, we heard freeway noise at all times, but it did not keep us from sleeping. We got used to it and did not notice after a short time. Your sensitivity to such noise may vary depending on where you are from and your home environment. We are from the L.A. area, so traffic noise is commonplace to us.

We had the 2 double beds room for a family of 4, with 2 boys, ages 9 & 12. The double bed was a bit small for the boys to share, but they managed. The other double bed was fine for my wife and me.

Very nice people and helpful. Didn't get her name, but she checked us in late Friday night and gave us some suggestions on visiting the wineries. We took her advice, went thru Sonoma and then over to Napa Valley awesome drive, all well worth it. The Bay cafe in the hotel, was very nice great breakfast menu and waiters were very nice too. Great place would stay again for our next visit. Next time Ill make sure to ask for an even number room, hopefully it won't face the area behind the hotel where the garbage is picked up, unfortunately on the 6th floor and still woke us up. Second night we stayed on the 9th floor-odd # room, but no noise from the garbage pickup early morning. Other than that all was great.

Thank you!

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: After a long and tiring day my friend & I wanted a nice glass of wine to wound down in the lounge. It was 10pm and they close at 11 so we went in. Finally got seated and the waiter chose to completely ignore us even tho there were only 2 other couples in the entire restaurant. I don't know if he was hoping we'd get mad and leave so he could go home or what, but it made for a very disappointing end to the evening. Finally got served and again another long wait for the bill---we finally simply got up and went to the cashier on our own. The woman who seated us (or rather, pointed to where we should sit) could've easily told the waiter to get a move on but never did. Very disappointing! Also was charged for parking on exiting the hotel, even tho I thought it had been added to my final bill---I'll never know since I never got any kind of receipt. I will not stay in a Crowne Plaza again and don't recommend it.
