We honestly received better service, and even the right information about the trains, from the cleaning crew and the gift shop lady.

Again, nobody was rude, but they weren't even trying to act pleasing or helpful.
I've stayed at Knights Inn that had better service, and that I've enjoyed more than this, for less money :(
review.positiveRemarks: The pool was nice and clean, and it was probably our favorite thing about the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The indifference of the staff was obvious and it was definitely our least favorite thing.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to find, close to Caltrain station, which was helpful...

review.title: Tale of Crown Plaza
review.reviewText: Clearly a hotel trying very hard to get better and become more classy. Several areas where you could see the attempt and feel they are almost there, but not quite. Being so close to the airport and freeway has its advantages and disadvantages, but I thought it thoughtful and somewhat humorous that the first thing I noticed on the pillows when entering the room were ear plugs. A little disconcerting...but thoughtful, although i did not need to use them, the air conditioner made sufficient noise to drown out the airplane and traffic noise. Shuttle service to and from airport and Bart connections was excellent, very helpful and extremely convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: Shuttle service, convenience to airport, room price was great
review.negativeRemarks: That they charge a parking fee and slowness of elevators
review.locationRemarks: A little noisy but it didn't effect me too much. Convenient to airport/ Bart connections, but hard to find a full market or convenience store.

review.title: Ok but not satisfied
review.reviewText: 1. Being close to highway, the room was pretty noisy. 2. $18/day for parking (Expedia should've notified us before hand). 3. Reserved for double bed room, but not available at checking. "up graded" to suite but boy, the sink counter top is smaller than the one in standard room.
review.negativeRemarks: $18/day for parking
review.locationRemarks: close to San Francisco Airport

review.title: REVIEW
review.reviewText: ALL EMPLOYEES WERE FRIENDLY EXCEPT THE FRONT DESK MAN NAMED DAVID. NO PEOPLE PERSONALITY. MAYBE IT JUST WASN'T HIS DAY.
review.negativeRemarks:
FRONT DESK (DAVID) NON CUSTOMER SERVICE PERSONALITY
& IF YOUR NOT USE TO THE NOISE OF THE TRAFFIC THE EAR PLUGS DO COME IN HANDY
review.locationRemarks: NEAR THE AIR PORT

review.title: Nice hotel, great location.
review.reviewText:
Overall a great hotel, staff was very nice. Our rooms (2) were not ready when we arrived but we arrived ahead of normal check in times, within 30 minutes of arriving they had our rooms ready and moved us to a higher floor. Breakfast wasn't included in our room rate, we did eat at the hotel - it was ok but for the price I would not eat breakfast there again.

I would stay at this hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: Must pay for parking
review.locationRemarks: East access from highway.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Clean, friendly. SFO is close, with some jet noise.

review.title: Great hotel if you have an early morning flight
review.reviewText: They even arranged for Hwertz to pick up my rental car; their shuttle to the airport next a.m. eas prompt and efficient.

review.title: It should have been torn down long ago!
review.reviewText:
Worst experience in San Francisco ever. The building is located right by the Highway 101 and Burlingame intersection. The reception (Mr. Baltazar) is a kind of person you don't want talk to him for a second. Although I asked him to give us a room with less noise, he gave us room # 403 which looks directly to the bridge. Level of noise and vibration is so high that no one can stand it. My friend who came hours after us got 1012, which was against the highway and no noise. So I went to his room at 2:00 AM. The other day I went to Mr. Baltazar and asked him to change my room but my answer was "sold out ". When I insisted he direct me to the manager and after half an hour the manager gave us quieter place.
Floor plan is funny, you should walk in a maze to reach to the lobby's elevator.
review.negativeRemarks: Absolutely everything!
review.locationRemarks: Location is good and convenient BUT the shell of the building, including all glazings should be changed to become up to code for noise and vibration.

review.title: This hotel sucks!!
review.reviewText:
There was no food after 9PM even though it's an airport hotel and flights were still coming in at 10. After a 5 hour flight from Hawaii there was no food. Not even vending machines. They had pop machines but no machine had bottled water and the water from the tap sucked. I have never been in a hotel that didn't have machines with bottled water and snacks.

The springs in my mattress were sticking up; I could feel them and they made noise when I moved around. There was no mini-fridge in the room. Any hotel over 3 stars should have one. I can't believe Expedia gives this a 3.7.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Doesn't matter.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: very nice hotel, but keep in your mind, they charge for car parking!!!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: car parking
review.locationRemarks: close to SFO airport

review.title: Pleasing stay
review.reviewText: Hotel is clean and impreesed with shuttle bus service

review.title: Not worth the money
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, but ridiculous you have to pay for parking, any breakast, and staff seem to feel "inconvenienced" any time you ask a question. Not what i expect from Crowne Plaza.
review.negativeRemarks: You have to pay $18/night for parking! And the standard continental breakfast is $11!

review.title: Hotel Review
review.reviewText: I just found that the room was a little small. Other than that, everything was perfect.

review.title: vacation away
review.reviewText: Very Clean, Staff was always available for help with elderly parents. Thanks for the comfortable stay. Shuttle service was a nice surprise, went shopping and did not have to drive.
review.negativeRemarks: Would have liked a small refrigerator.
review.locationRemarks: Was close and the shuttle service was great.

review.title: nice stay
review.reviewText: Nice place n location, great staff, $18 night parking

review.title: Good overnight stay near SFO
review.reviewText: The main advantage is for travelers using SFO. The shuttle service is reliable from the hotel to the airport. The restaurant is only mediocre, but the service for our family group was pleasant and helpful. The lobby is tired and has little comfortable seating. Breakfast started too late for our early flight.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity of SFO with free shuttle. WiFi is extra
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby

review.title: Room with a View ( of the Freeway)
review.reviewText: Room was very noisy and rest of hotel was geared to a lower end traveller. Staff were not helpful or welcoming.

review.title: STENCH
review.reviewText: I WAS PUT IN A HANDICAP ROOM. THE BATHROOM HAD HORRIBLE STENCH TO IT. I REQUESTED TO BE MOVED TO A ANOTHER ROOM, BUT WAS TOLD THAT ALL ROOMS WERE TAKEN. THEY FINALLY MOVED ME TO A ANOTHER ROOM ON SECOND AND FINAL DAY OF MY STAY. I HAD MADE MY RESEVERATION ABOUT SIX WEEKS PRIOR TO MY STAY, AND THIS IS THE CROWN PLAZE COULD DO. I WILL NEVER AT A CROWN PLAZE AGAIN!!!

review.title: OK, but not what I expect from Crowne Paza
review.reviewText: The staff, except one of the Bellman who was great, the others seem to not really pay much attention. They helped us ans as soon they were done with us went back to their sorting of rooms. The shuttle for the airport had just left and we tried to catch it and the staff did not even acknowledge or wanted to offer to stop to shuttle. The windows in our room were discusting and dirty.
review.positiveRemarks: One of the Bellman who was really helpfull and friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Unfortunatly the staff

review.title: Hotel review
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice and close to what we wanted to visit. The previous reviews helped me make my decision on choosing a hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to airport and price through Expedia
review.negativeRemarks: Cost to park a car
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to Airport and easy access

review.title: Crowne Plaza SFO
review.reviewText: The food was really good-very healthy and the shuttle availalbility every 30 minutes made it very convenient to get back and forth from the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: furthest away from other restaurants.
review.locationRemarks: see above

review.title: Comfortable Stay
review.reviewText: The room was clean and very comfortable. We encountered no problems with checking in, checking out or during our stay.
review.locationRemarks:
We have stayed in this hotel before and the location is great for us. We go North,
we go South and we are in the hub of everything.

review.title: comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText:
Enjoyed the light meal we had at the Cafe. It would have been nice if a notice of the early bird special was posted in our room.
The convenience to the airport was important.

review.title: Not Worth the "Convenience"
review.reviewText: There are better deals to be had around SFO than this dump. I booked for a 1 night stay on the way out of SFO, thinking I was getting a good deal for "Crowne Plaza"... guess again. First and foremost, the parking situation is ENTRAPMENT - plain and simple. You park in their parking lot, then when you check in they mention the $18 nightly parking fee. There is NO mention of this exorbitant fee beforehand - only after you've parked and are checking in. Secondly, the elevators are noisy, clunky and unreliable.. I felt like I was on the Tower of Terror theme park ride at MGM Studios - except this was the real thing. Third - our room was dirty.. it made my skin crawl to be there - I'm not normally a squeamish traveler - quite the opposite, actually. Don't let the name "Crowne Plaza" fool you: this place sucks
review.positiveRemarks: I was only there for one night
review.negativeRemarks: I had to stay there for a whole night
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to the airport... just like 20 other hotels in the area.

review.title: Modern and Clean in a Good Location
review.reviewText: Hotel feels recently renovated. Great location by downtown Burlingame, Airport, SF and the Bay Trail. Will need shuttles or an auto to get around.

review.title: Good Stay
review.reviewText: Stay was very good. Very comfortable bed. Got a great night sleep two nights in a row. Improvements that could be made would be to have a refrigerator in the room and also free WIFI instead of charging $9.95/day.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean nice room. One of the most comfortable beds I've had in any hotel
review.negativeRemarks: No refrigerator in room. No free WIFI. They charged $9.95/day.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport. Not much near the hotel. Must drive to Downtown Burlingame.

review.title: You may want to take a cab
review.reviewText:
Be aware that the shuttle to the hotel runs every half hour. Or so. So I stood on the kerb at the airport for 50 minutes. By which time, I could have been downtown. On the way back into the airport, the shuttle was overloaded - to the point of standing room only - at our hotel, which was tough for the other two hotels it was supposed to pick up from.

The hotel itself has seen better days, but the room was clean, the mattress comfortable, and the water was hot.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle service
review.locationRemarks: Airport hotel wilderness

review.title: Crowne Plaza
review.reviewText: Very nice place to stay. Staff a little rude and unaccomadating. I would stay here again because of the convenience for the airport. It was a peaceful place to stay as far as airport noise. Food fairly good.
review.locationRemarks: Nice and close to the airport. Noise level from airport non-existent which was a plus.

review.title: Parking Fee. . .
review.reviewText: Watch the exorbitant parking fees if you have a car!! Nice otherwise.

review.title: Ok, I guess
review.reviewText: Parking wasnt the greatest. 18.00/night. The hotel seemed a little vacant.
review.positiveRemarks: Favortie thing was how close it was to the water. Good for family walks along the shore, watching planes land....
review.negativeRemarks: Least fave was the parking payment....
review.locationRemarks: Great!

review.title: Your Standard 'Airport Hotel'
review.reviewText:
The noise from the freeway that is right next to the hotel .... is pretty loud. They put one pair of foam earplugs in a little gift box with a blind fold. There were two of us.

Also... the cost of parking here is a rip-off. $18.00! There is no other affordable option.
Expedia told us parking was free! They discounted the fee to $10.00 when I complained.
review.negativeRemarks: Freeway noise and expensive parking.

review.title: Quick stay over for Seminar near SF Airport
review.reviewText: This is a very old hotel. They normally charge $18.00 for parking, but I got that charge waived. It is located right next to Interstate 101, and all the rooms face the freeway. It does not have dual pane windows. Some guests may find it noisy for sleeping, but I had no problem sleeping. The rooms are small, but adequate. It is cheaper than comparable hotels near the San Francisco Airport in Burlingame. It has nice amenities. I would recommend it to business travelers, and anyone looking for a nice hotel near the SF Airport.
review.negativeRemarks: $18 parking fee, lost in the fine print of the Expedia listing."
review.locationRemarks: Located much too close to Route 101, and about two miles from SF Airport."

review.title: Crowne plaza
review.reviewText:
No Complaints....not sure why all the negative reviews....ideal location from SFO and the highway 101....literally off ramp and straight into hotel car park....mentioning CarPark....only negative is the 18 dollar per night charge...hotel please review this charge only thing letting you down an the 10 dollar per night Wi-Fi charge...,

Overall good stay and no complaints

review.title: Brief review
review.reviewText: A bit dingy, older feeling hotel. Neither terrible nor good.

review.title: Decent value
review.reviewText: Hotel was adequate and front desk staff was accommodating. Room service was not great but everything else was fine.

review.title: Good Hotel Close to Airport
review.reviewText: Great hotel close to airport. Provides shuttle free of charge. The food in bar and cafe is good, reasonably priced.
review.negativeRemarks: Towels thin and needs more coffee cups
review.locationRemarks: Great location very close to airport and shuttle a plus

review.title: Front Desk Staff Are Not Nice
review.reviewText: The front desk staff were not very pleasant to deal with. I don't think I ever got a "hello" or "thank you" once from them. At the airport, I called to check the status of the shuttle (which was 20 minutes late), and the front desk staff conveyed annoyance that I was contacting them. The shuttle driver was nice, and offered to load my luggage, and I'm sure they were running late because it was busy. But the front desk staff puts off this really negative vibe. I probably won't stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk staff
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport

review.title: Over ally good to stay
review.reviewText:
Room is okay except the carpet seems need to be changed.
Parking fee is rediculous.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is very close to downtown if you drive a car.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee
review.locationRemarks: Convenience to downtown if you have a car

review.title: Take your swimming trunks and $18 for parking
review.reviewText: Heated pool was a bonus. Parking is $18 extra. Near public park with huge playground; might be significant for family with kids.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee.
review.locationRemarks: Off the interstate; on the coast; near airport.

review.title: Poor Service
review.reviewText: With the exception of one guy, the staff gave lousy service. Couldn't hardly get decent directions or information. It didn't help that it was hard to understand them. Heard the highway because it sounded like the window was open even though it wasn't. The hotel was listed on bed bug report. The elevators sounded like they were on their last leg. Duct tape was used on a seam in the hallway carpet. $18/night for parking.

review.title: Not too impressed
review.reviewText: My stay was just ... Unfortunately the bathroom still had used towels left there and the chair at the desk had makeup on it. I called the front desk to inform them and they apologized but never came to clean or replace towels. The room was pretty small and needed updating. If I had to stay more than two nights it definitely would have been irritating.
review.positiveRemarks: The pool was clean and spacious.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms were too small and old looking.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great for where I needed to be.

review.title: Quite Good Overall
review.reviewText: We were instantly met by a very friendly desk person who kindly upgraded us to a suite for no apparent reason. Room was comfortable and quiet enough for two sleepy people to get a good night's rest. Fitness room was perfectly fine and typical for this size of a hotel. Housekeeping staff was very helpful and efficient with helping us recover an article of clothing we forgot in the room. Overall quite good and very convenient to SFO.

review.title: Just perfect for us!
review.reviewText: Everything about the hotel was just fine! They were able to accommodate us, even when we had to come in late. The staff was very friendly and helped us out with the airport shuttle to SFO the next morning. It's not a Waldorf Astoria, but they had excellent rooms that met all of our needs and personnel that was fantastic! Will definitely come back!
review.positiveRemarks: The friendly staff! They helped us with everything!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing of note :)
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect, being so close to SFO. Extremely convenient!

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: Simply an ok hotel. Nothing great and nothing terrible. Older hotel but clean. Our room was right next to an outdoor, huge air conditioner and was pretty loud.

review.title: A nice stay
review.reviewText: Hotel management was very helpful in giving us tips on what to do and how to get about very easily around San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Freeway traffic noise
review.locationRemarks: Location handy for plane and BART

review.title: Older hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel needs a full renovation. Very old room (badly stained carpet; wallpaper coming off, etc). We were given the "quietest room" but it was still loud with highway traffic. For the price I would not recommend. The only good point was Johnny who worked in the restaurant -- he was very accommodating and had good customer service.

review.title: Shuttle service to/from Airport Bonus
review.reviewText: Very reasonably priced hotel. Free shuttle service to/from the airport was very convenient, makes for an easy way to take BART into the city. Oldish looking hotel from the outside and lobby area, but rooms seemed to have all the comforts of a higher priced hotel,
review.positiveRemarks: Ear plugs and eye mask in cute little bag on bed a nice touch.
review.negativeRemarks: Oldish looking lobby, no restaurant or hotel bar
review.locationRemarks: 5 minutes from airport

review.title: An OK hotel, just
review.reviewText: It's just an OK hotel. Both phones were unplugged in my room and I couldn't figure out quickly how to plug them back in. I only discovered this when the milk was missing from my $28 american breakfast order with tea, and I had to call room service--by cellphone in the end. The hotel's layout is weird with the door far from parking (which is $18 per day) and the elevator hard to find at first. Nothing awful here, but luckily the price was low.
review.locationRemarks: my room was very noisy with loud traffic noise from the adjacent Highway 101

review.title: Make it a short stay and eat out!
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel itself and furnishing were good to excellent. The cost of the room service, no refrigerator in the room, listening to the concierge and front desk personnel trading barbs at each other and the constant noise from the nearby expressway were offputting to say the least. Paying for parking in the hotel parking lot as a guest is nothing short of nickle and diming the customers to make up for the relatively low cost they advertise for the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Expressway noise and having to witness hotel personnel making fun of each other while customers were around.
review.locationRemarks: Nearby Burlingame City Park and ocean walk was nice. Not many nearby places to eat.

review.title: Newly room
review.reviewText:
Very Comfortable and Newly Room
nice person at front desk

review.title: Better hotels around the area for less
review.reviewText: Not worth the price...even with the Expedia special rates...

review.title: Excellent Hotel near SFO
review.reviewText:
The welcome and introduction was very nice. My room overlooked the expressway and, although I was on the 6th floor, I was bothered by the night time traffic noise. The room and bathroom were nicely appointed and the TV had surround sound, which was a very nice surprise.

The shuttle to the airport was prompt and above the usual standard--plenty of room for luggage in back and very comfortable seats. It is a short ride to the terminals--and leaving early in the morning, this was a real plus.

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: After reading some of the reviews on this hotel, I was rather concerned about what we would find. The unit was large, with a sitting room with couch, chairs, TV and desk, separate bedroom and huge bathroom (it was wheelchair accessible with a large walk-in shower). Carpet a little worn but the room was clean and comfortable. We looked out at a concrete retaining wall but we weren't there for the view. It was also very quiet and we did not receive earplugs as part of the complimentary items in the room. The only complaint would be that even on low the fan on the heating/cooling unit was too breezy, we just put one of the many bed pillows over the vent. Staff was friendly and we appreciated the free airport shuttle service.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport

review.title: Its the little things that add up!
review.reviewText:
This was listed as a four star hotel but it is not. The towels and amenities are the same as other Crown Plazas, but the physical plant of this hotel is old - like a redone Holiday Inn from 1960.

With single pane windows there is a lot of freeway noise and air coming into the room from outside. The rooms are small and the interior furnishings were not scaled down from what they purchase for other properties, so the dresser sticks out into where you pass by the bed and if you are not careful you'll have a nice bruise on your thigh from a sharp dresser corner.

They also charge $18.00 for parking and $9.95 for Internet use. The breakfast buffet is expensive.

I thought I got a good rate but after paying more for other things I would have been better off down the street
review.negativeRemarks: Paying for parking
review.locationRemarks: Good location on Hwy 101 just south of the airport

review.title: Average Hotel
review.reviewText: Its an Airport Hotel to spend a night or two. Not bad not very good.

review.title: Not Bad but can be better
review.reviewText: It would be nice to have water kettle in the hotel room. No breakfast or complementary coffee in the lobby. The hotel is OK but feel very cold & unfriendly. I waited 40 minutes for the hotel shuttle bus to pick up in the airport.
review.locationRemarks: Location is good

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Overall, I found the Crowne Plaza to be comfortable, but a bit loud due to the close proximity of the freeway.

review.title: Comfortable but out of the way from the city!
review.reviewText: The front desk people were so helpful in planning my traveling through the city. They were overall very friendly and polite and I had no problems with my stay here. I wish they had complimentary internet, instead of having you pay $9.99 for a day. (or even have an hourly charge rather than have you buy for the entire day.) but otherwise, I found everything to be comfortable and the service to be friendly. It is a little out of the way from the city. You have to take the hotel shuttle (which IS complimentary) all the way to the airport to catch the bart to get in the city. So if you're planning to be out and about in Downtown San Fran, I'd try to book a hotel in the city proper. But if you're going to just be in and out of the airport, it's a great value for its price and very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: out of way from the bart & the city proper
review.locationRemarks: close to the airport, far away from the city.

review.title: Acceptable!
review.reviewText:
The location off the strip makes it obligatory to take the monorail all the time, which is costly.
The laundrry was a mess. The spa was nice. One pays for the water bottles left in the room! But the worse is that they were sold out when I arrived ; so I had a room without bed and without shower for one night. Apart from that, it's clean and nice.spa even
review.positiveRemarks: spa even if the pool was closed for maintenance.
review.negativeRemarks: Laundry, location. No entertainment in the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Out of the strip.

review.title: Somewhat satisfied
review.reviewText: Business meetings and the elevator was slow and had to wait a while to get up to our room. Guest were loud outside our room till late. You could hear between the rooms so not real private unless you had the TV on. Convient location to the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Had to pay 18.00 a day for parking and that someone could hear what you say--thin walls.
review.locationRemarks: Great.

review.title: Does not live up to name
review.reviewText: Was pretty unimpressed with this hotel ... the staff were impatient and rude. I would not recommend staying here, unless you can ignore poor service for a cheap price.

review.title: Okay for a one night stay.
review.reviewText: Unfortunately, our room location was facing the freeway and SFO. We had to turn on the fan to drown out the news from the freeway and airplanes taking off from SFO.

review.title: Expected more for the price
review.reviewText: Room was small, no mini fridge, parking cost $18/night, breakfast not included. The hotel and staff were fine, but overall, for the price I paid, I was expecting more.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was small, no mini fridge
review.locationRemarks: Hotel was very convenient to SFO airport, but not much else around.

review.title: pleasent stay
review.reviewText: There was a miss comunication with the parking charges, but a manager took care off the problem.
review.negativeRemarks: parking

review.title: Pleasant
review.reviewText:
I found this hotel perfectly pleasant for a night. The airport shuttle is frequent, the staff were efficient, the room was clean. What more do you need?

OK, there is some noise from the freeway next door, but I didn’t find it bothersome (it was quieter than many other hotel air conditioning systems I have come across in the past). There is also some aircraft noise but hey, it's near the airport so no surprises there!

I was leaving SFO on an afternoon flight and took a very pleasant stroll through Bayside Park next door and along the waterfront to Anza Lagoon. There is a water treatment works nearby though, so I can’t comment what it’s like in the summer.
review.negativeRemarks: Some road noise
review.locationRemarks: Handy location

review.title: Clean and comfortable.
review.reviewText: This hotel was decent for my visit. If you're staying at the Crowne Plaza and will spend most of your time in the room, it is a bit cramped. My room was a little noisy as it was facing the freeway but the room was clean and comfortable and in a decent area. Parking, however, was a bit pricey.

review.title: Met Expectations
review.reviewText: Don't forget to add the expensive nightly parking fee to whatever room rate they quote. One of many very boring hotels in that area. Of the bunch it is the one closest to the highway, furthest from the running path along the water. The downtown area on the other side of the highway (use footbridge or drive) has restaurants. All of the in-hotel restaurants in this area are terrible values.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Perfect location, not too far from Frisco, The location offers a relaxed enviornment away from the city traffic jams. The sorrounding neighborhoods offer some rather good eats and shopping.

review.title: The price was right but the rooms were just ok.
review.reviewText: Room was ok and the interstate was a little loud but location was good and fairly close to airport. Because I booked through Expedia they wouldn't honor my Priority Club points and I couldn't receive any points for my stay.
review.locationRemarks: The city

review.title: Ok, but probably won't go
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and near the airport.

review.title: One day at the Crown Plaza
review.reviewText: This Crown Plaza is good for what you pay. The food is really good but a bit pricey. The room is noisy but then again you are close to the airport and next to a freeway. I wouldn't mind staying here again.

review.title: We alwasys stay here
review.reviewText: whenever we travel, this is the place we stay the night before our flights. It's very clean, the location is perfect and the staff have always been very nice to work with.

review.title: Nice for the money.
review.reviewText: Room was small but comfortable. Nice for the money.

review.title: Couldn't wait to leave. Too close to the freeway.
review.reviewText:
We were put in a corner room on the fourth floor and it was so close to the freeway that we might as well have been sleeping in our car. We called down to asked if we could change rooms and were told it was sold out. We truly didn't believe that. They actually had a supply of earplugs in the room.

Also the headboard was loose and everytime we we moved around it made a banging noise against the wall.

I like to sleep in but I was up by 5 am because it was so loud. Couldn't wait to get out of that room.

Never stay again.

review.title: SFO Arport Hotel Stay
review.reviewText: Convenient and close to the airport with free shuttle.

review.title: Crowne Plaza - Good location but extra charges
review.reviewText:
Overall, the hotel is acceptable and a good choice if you're getting into SFO late and don't want to drive far. Very good location if you want easy access to the freeway.

However, take into consideration that there is a parking charge of $18.00 per day. This charge along with an almost $20 minimum charge for breakfast will easily add an extra $40 onto your bill. In addition, the hotel physically sits right next to the northbound 101 freeway. Thus, any rooms on the side facing the freeway will have some freeway sound. However, the hotel automatically places an eye mask and ear plugs on each bed which is helpful.

review.title: Didn't like the hotel
review.reviewText: It doesn't look clean. The carpet everywhere has black spots.

review.title: It's fair............
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean, staff were really helpful and friendly, really close to SFO, but for me the surrounding neighborhood was a little bit noisy. BTW...hotel's restaurant was really nice..I love their steak!!!!!!!!!!!

review.title: Over priced compaired to holiday inn and suites and doubletree
review.reviewText: No wash rags no ice bucket no coffee pot or microwave.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown area

review.title: Very decent hotel
review.reviewText: This was our first stay in San Francisco. We came for our very first 49ers game. Although we were only in the room to sleep because of our full schedule, it was nice. The staff was very nice and helpful. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. It was a decent distance from candle stick park and getting to and from the hotel was very easy. We would stay there again.

review.title: Good stuff
review.reviewText: Nice and close to airport. Free shuttle service was nice. Good breakfast but a little pricy.

review.title: Crowne Plaza SF
review.reviewText: Although the room was very clean and comfortable, it was also located right next to the freeway at the back of the hotel. I would urge you to ask for a room as far as possible from the freeway!!

review.title: Good Experience
review.reviewText: Shuttle to and from airport is very convenient!!!

review.title: more personal
review.reviewText: i would go back

review.title: Clean and comfortable.
review.reviewText: Pleasant service. Cheerfully changed our room to a quieter one. Free shuttle service starts at 4 a.m. Comfortable beds. Wifi and parking charges a disappointment.

review.title: Comfortable, but unexpected charges..
review.reviewText:
this hotel is close to SFO, relatively new, comfortable and clean. The first room they gave us had a previous smoking guest, they changed our room without question.

This room was prepaid through Expedia, however when we got home there was an unexpected $50.00 charge on our card. Subsequently called and they said that they do this to every person who stays there, and if there were no charges they then issue a refund.

They also charge $18.00 per night for parking, which seems a bit high.

Very unsual practice, never happened before in all our travels. A backasswards way of doing business.

review.title: Moderately Dissatisfied
review.reviewText: While the hotel was nice looking, it sorely lacks in the "extras" for its guests that nearby hotels feature. Parking was $18 per night, WiFi was $10 per night, and breakfast was available only in the pay-as-you-go restaurant onsite. The air conditioner in our room was not working. When we arrived in the room, only the overhead light in the little foyer area would come on... All of the others (between beds, near chair, on desk) plus the TV would not come on. After calling maintenance (but before he got to our room) we discovered that some prankster had unplugged ALL of the lamps and TV in the room... Something housekeeping should have noticed and remedied. When we return to SF tomorrow, we will be staying at a different hotel near airport which features 10 days of free parking, free Internet in rooms, free breakfast, free airport shuttle--all for quite a few $$ less than this Crowne Plaza. And I bet the lights and TV in the room will be operational when I get there.

review.title: A little worn out
review.reviewText: It was once a very nice hotel, but a little worn out. Good value all things considered.

review.title: Never Again
review.reviewText: This was the only available room because of several conventions in town so I was happy to get a reservation. Upon arrival we discovered that we had to pay for parking. Our room seemed adequate -- until I entered the bathroom to see that it had towels all over the floor and hadn't been cleaned. A quick call to the front desk and we were immediately switched to another room and given ONE ticket for a free breakfast -- since I'm travelling with my husband I thought that was pretty rude considering the condition of the room we were in. When I booked the room I noted that it was a "Bay View" -- which I decided was the reason for the high price. The room in fact had no view of water but had a great view of the freeway and accompanying noise. Bottom line, we had a room. We had to pay for internet connection, parking and breakfast. At the price I paid I expected a lot more. Management was not helpful and very slow to check us out in the morning. The hotel is old and has not aged gracefully except in the lobby. I would never stay here again.

review.title: Great stay, great price.
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel for the price. We wanted a hotel close to the city without the city price and that is what we got. We opted for the buffet breakfast add on and it was well worth the price. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: OK except for parking and internet access
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but you have to pay $18 per night to park your car and $10 a night for internet

review.title: decent
review.reviewText: parking fee's are ridiculous and wi-fi should be free and available in all rooms.

review.title: Great experience.
review.reviewText: Accomodations were fabulous. Hotel employees were all very friendly and helpful. Had a great time and would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Close to SFO
review.reviewText: convenient and close to SFO -- frequent shuttles to airport

review.title: good deal
review.reviewText: very good for the price

review.title: Crowne Parking
review.reviewText: The charge for parking is ridiculous-$18.00/night! We did not learn about this charge when we booked with Expedia. Would have been nice to know.

review.title: Clean hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel situated by freeway which caused a humming sound through the night. My friend actually thought it was the sound of airplane engines all night. Hotel is updated and very clean. I liked the fact that the front desk but us on one of the top two floors which can only be activated through the elevator with our room key. Which felt like an added security measure for two women traveling.

review.title: Far too noisy
review.reviewText: I was quite surprised to find a "care package" with ear plugs upon entering the room. The room I was given faced the highway and I could hear it over and above the very noisy air conditioner. Would not go back, despite the convenience of free airport shuttle.

review.title: Great Location and good price
review.reviewText:
Hotel has free shuttle service to the airport. The reason for my 4 stars in service is that hotel is charging $18.00 per day for the parking. I would rather look for a hotel with free parking and pay $ 18.00 more in room price.

Anything over $ 5.00 per day when you are staying in a hotel is too much.
Otherwise hotel is very good.

review.title: Be prepared to pay!
review.reviewText: The room was nice. They were clean, new decor and the bed was comfortable. However I would not stay here again. I should have read the fees because it is $18 a day just to park your car here! We decided to save the $18 and park across the pedestrian walk way in the neighborhood and walk back to our room. Fortunately the weather was nice enough to do this. Also, this hotel does not offer any sort of complimentary breakfast. The restaurant on site is way over priced and the food is awful! The pizza tasted like rubber and had no flavor at all. I would stay somewhere else next time. There are plenty of hotels in the area that offer free parking for their patrons, complimentary breakfast items and restaurants close by that offer better food for a more affordable price. Bottom line you can get more for your money and the same comfort at another hotel.

review.title: Crown Plaza Burlingame
review.reviewText: The hotel is old with small rooms. It sits next to a freeway and the single pane windows do little to keep the sound of traffic out

review.title: Great for Overnight
review.reviewText:
We always enjoy staying at this hotel for when we fly overseas.
Staff are very helpful and the food in the restaurant very good.

review.title: Not my idea of a good hotel
review.reviewText: The Crowne Plaza is clean, the staff is adequate, the restaurant food is edible, but I would not recommend the place for anything more than a bed and a shower. The hotel, the hotel staff, the restaurant servers and every other employee I encountered had no warmth, no personality, nothing to recommend them. And the rooms are noisy, really noisy. There is a major highway that seemed to run through my room. This was my second stay at the Crowne Plaza and I will probably not stay there on my next trip. The price would be great if the staff were welcoming, even congenial or if the facility were not so sterile.

review.title: SF Hotel
review.reviewText:
People were very good. Bathroom a but small.
Could have been further away from the freeway. Overall experience was fine -

review.title: Mediocre at best.
review.reviewText: Front desk was friendly and helpful. Parking was too expensive and uncovered.

review.title: Very Cute Retro Decor
review.reviewText: We were on a 15 hour layover from Oahu to Cleveland. I chose the Crowne Plaza because the price was excellant and they had a free airport shuttle. Very cute! I liked the retro decor. Very clean too. The bathroom in our room was spotless. I wish the city had something as nice for the price by the Wharf.

review.title: Only if you like noise
review.reviewText: Overall this is a very nice hotel but, it's location is right next to an extremely busy freeway. The noise was continuous...

review.title: Great location for getting to and from San Francisco or the south bay.
review.reviewText: This is a generally decent hotel. Great location in relation to the airport, San Francisco and the south bay. Not ultra luxurious, but absolutely clean and pleasantly maintained. I've stayed here 6-8 times so far.

review.title: Not a place to SLEEP...
review.reviewText: Forget paying the price of a room for the pleasure of sleeping on the Freeway. Just bring your backpack and a sleeping bag and you will simulate the experience! They REALLY need soundproof windows...

review.title: A parking fee also!!!??? Never again!
review.reviewText: I'm used to paying a parking fee when in San Francisco but not hear the airport and I've stayed at a lot of SF airport hotels. The size of this one was about 40% of the hotel room rate.

review.title: Great place for a mini Honey Moon
review.reviewText:
Cute place and very romantic layout.. non-expensive and most of all CLEAN!
had a good time. We also went down to the bar and the guy down there made us laugh through the whole time. He is so funny and customer service oriented. Very down to earth. I will definetly come back. =)

review.title: Crowne Plaza Experience
review.reviewText: Great experience! Hotel lobby was nicely remodeled. Customer service at the front desk was excellent. Extremely friendly employees. Complimentary newspapers. Upper floors were being remodeled at the time of visit. Indoor heated pool and spa are great. Nice flat screen tv in room. Only complaint was remote for TV as it didn’t seam to work properly. Location of hotel seem kind of secluded. Overall great experience. Would recommend.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: I received a room upgrade when checking in. That was a nice surprise.

review.title: Too loud (next to freeway) and parking was expensive.
review.reviewText: This hotel was located well but we got a room right next to the (major) freeway. It was loud. We could take that or a room with only one double bed somewhere else in the hotel. Also -- they charged (a lot) for parking which we didn't expect. Next time we are in the area, we will stay elsewhere.

review.title: "Wouldnt give this a three star rating"
review.reviewText: Hotel is very old and outdated. It has a 3 1/2 star rating. I would give it a 2 1/2

review.title: it was a great family experience
review.reviewText: it was a great place to stay with two young children!

review.title: Room very noisy;too close to elevator;water turned off during shower
review.reviewText: Was not pleased with this hotel. Rooms need to be updated; very noisy from elevator and outside noise. Water ran poorly and did not get hot enough for showers. Water would sometimes stop running while taking shower.

review.title: won't go back
review.reviewText:
Breakfast for around 15 dollars, parking for 17 dollars per day, internet for 10 (don't remember the exact number). Every service has a price.
The free wi-fi at lobby doesn't work, although the staff said it was just a fluke.
When you need to take a shower, it took over 5 min before the water is barely warm.
Only one thing that we are satisfied with this hotel is the airport shuttle service is quite reliable. But with so many other hotels offering the same if not better services, I don't see any reason for us to go back to Crown plaza next time.

review.title: Great airport hotel
review.reviewText: Room a little small but with a great bed. Airport shuttle service works extremely well with a stop right at the BART station for those wanting to see the sights or do a little shopping downtown. Breakfast is good and at a resonable price.

review.title: Good place to stay near San Francisco International Airport
review.reviewText: Good place to stay if you are near the airport.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The room was just a "room". The fitness center was not in good shape - no pun intended. One tredmill did not work and the weight machine was hard to use because of the adjustments. I don't think I would choose this hotel again.

review.title: CP-SFO Airport
review.reviewText: Highway noise was loud inside room. Otherwise, a very good value if you need a place to overnight into or out of San Francicso International Airport.

review.title: Given the central location, would most likely return again. The room was exceptional.
review.reviewText: Good location and the hotel includes a very nice restaurant and sports bar (WEST BAY GRILL), which had great food & was reasonably priced. The included Breakfast Buffet (Continental Breakfast) as well worth the visit each morning. We we pleasantly surprised with the extent of the buffet offerings and the reasonable prices for the lunch and dinner menus at the WEST BAY. No need to leave the hotel for a nice meal.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: ok hotel, a bit run-down for a Crown Plaza, service was ok, probably will not stay @ a Crown Plaza for a long time ........ quite disappointed

review.title: Not going back
review.reviewText: It was horrible, I request a Non smoking room and they did not have one available for me. So, they gave me a smoking room that smelled like a used ashtray. All my clothes got impregnated of cigarette smell. The price I paid was very expensive also.

review.title: Itz all good
review.reviewText: The airport shuttle was handy for catching the BART to downtown San Francisco. Not a lot to see or do nearby the hotel in the evenings & the neighbourhood is mostly industrial. The hot tub fits 2 to 3 people (at best) the picture on website is deceiving, but we generally had the pool / hot tub to ourselves later in the evening. The breakfast buffet was delicious with a good variety and the servers made us feel welcome & kept our refreshments topped up. The restaurant prices are pricey, but the bar menu is reasonably priced with good food.

review.title: Good choice for an airport stay
review.reviewText: This is a renovated hotel. The rooms are nice and the beds excellent. The hallways look like a college dorm, but for a quick airport stay that does not matter. At the terrific rate I got from Expedia--less than I have paid in the past to stay at a shabby motel in San Bruno--this is the best deal at SFO. The shuttle really does operate on the schedule posted, another airport hotel necessity.

review.title: NOT GREAT.
review.reviewText: CROWN PLAZA SHOULD HAVE HIGHER STANDARDS.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful. Also, the airport transportation was very good even at the late hour of our flight. However, the condition of the room was disappointing. The carpet was worn and dirty which gave bad impression as soon as you walked in the door.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText:
Pleasant employees, uncomfortable beds even though they advertise they are concerned about your comfort and good sleep. Not offered a remedy to problem and wrote off $10 in internet fees for trouble.

I was also suprised to be charged $16 per day for parking. This was never mentioned during the reservation process or it would have made a difference on where I stayed. The security in the parking lot was not great either since a guest came in to complain about vandalism while I was in the lobby checking out.

review.title: S.F. Stay
review.reviewText: Hotel adequate for the short visit.

review.title: Exceptional deal!
review.reviewText:
The hotel was a pleasant surprise. It was clean, well managed; nice excercise room with dry sauna, pool, whirlpool, good restaurant, business center with free computer use, free copies and a wonderful walking trail along the bay. They also provide free busing to and from the airport and they stored our luggage after we checcked out and allowed us to come back that evening for busing to the airport.
If you're looking for restaurants, drug stores, etc to walk to, there is nothing near enough to walk to.

review.title: VERY NICE HOTEL
review.reviewText: A VERY NICE HOTEL, CLEAN, EASY ACCESS FROM THE HOTEL TO THE AIRPORT WITH SHUTTLE BUS. WOULD RECOMMEND.

review.title: Would use again
review.reviewText: The staff was polite and helpful, rooms clean and comfortable, food was expensive in hotel restaurant.

review.title: SF Airport
review.reviewText: Good value for airport location

review.title: Good Deal especially for travelers
review.reviewText: I love to stay at the Crowne Plaza SFO and do so regularly. The hotel is wonderful. My only complaint is that I booked through Expedia for 2 adults and 2 children for rates that stated breakfast buffet included and at the hotel, I received vouchers for only two of us for the breakfast and had to pay for the other two.

review.title: Restaurant not up to par.
review.reviewText: Great hotel as I have come to expect from Crowne Plaza. I was disappointed in the restaurant/bar. I was hoping for restaurant food and I got bar food.

review.title: Not impress
review.reviewText: No free internet even in the lobby. No gift shop to get snacks. Like the pool and work out room. For a four star rated hotel not impress.

review.title: Linda
review.reviewText: There's not too many places to eat around there, you must have a car to get around. Not bad over all.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText:
Over all, was disappointed:
-room was extremely small, cramped for two people
-it is too close to the freeway and thus, very noisy.
-Hot tub was out of service for two days.
-they charged for parking each day
-only got our newspaper one day out of the five

I have come to expect more from Crown Plaza and this hotel did not meet expectations.

review.title: unpleasant stay
review.reviewText: They should have used some of their 20m budget for some sound proof windows for the rooms that face the very busy 101 highway.It is almost impossible to get any sleep. Our overnight stay was unpleaseant from the get go. We travelled for two weeks throughout California and this establishment was the ONLY place we stayed that charged for parking and wireless internet. The room we were in wasn't very spacious and we had to be quite inventive to be able to open up our two pieces of luggage. On the positive side, the room was clean and modern, but when you can't get a good nights sleep because of highway noise, you leave the hotel not in the best of moods.

review.title: San Francisco Crowne Plaza SFO
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and clean. It was also convienent to the BART train and the freeway. But. I could not figure out why a hotel such as this had free wi-fi in the lobby and meeting areas while the guests had to pay per day to have the wi-fi in their rooms. The hotel was also charging for parking. I probably would not say at this hotel again because of those two reasons. I have stayed at quite a few IHG hotels and have not had to pay for wi-fi or parking an any of them except the ones overseas.

review.title: good value for money for a crowne plaza
review.reviewText: good place, was expecting better pickup and drop service to theairport, was expecting a better fitness center considering it to be crowneplaza; a coffee shop

review.title: Clean and comfortable at a decent price
review.reviewText:
Due to a last minute change of plans, we decided to leave Napa early and stay close to the airport (SFO) to make our early flight the next day. We booked the Crowne Plaza the same day we wanted to check in. There were no problems with the reservation system. They were ready for us when we got there.

The room was clean and nicely appointed. One item that would have been nice had we been staying more than overnight would be a small refrigerator.

The only real complaint we had was the hallway on our floor smelled faintly of cigarette smoke when we checked in. The next morning it seemed as though the smell intensified and creep into our room.

If you need to be near the airport, I would certainly recommend the Crowne Plaza.

review.title: Comfortable, worth it.
review.reviewText: The Crown Plaza near the SFO was easy to get to with the complimentary shuttle service, friendly front desk & concierge people and spacious, comfortable rooms with decent storage. Good showers too. For the price, this hotel was GREAT value.

review.title: Good but a little noisy
review.reviewText: Good and reasonably priced. Clean. Pleasant proximity to the bay. Unpleasant proximity to highway.

review.title: Good quality airport hotel
review.reviewText: The Crowne-Plaza SFO is in an area on the bay surrounded by other hotels. It is a standard Crowne-Plaza with quite decent rooms (although they are a little small), a decent restaurant, pleasant ambiance. We've never had any problems there, although we prefer the Crowne Plaza in Foster City, next to San Mateo, which has larger rooms. All in all, they are both nice places to stay. Recommended.

review.title: San Fran Experience
review.reviewText: Check in was smooth, professional and courteous. The trip was paid for by a company card, but I had to show a card when I checked in but asked that any additional charges be added to the card that paid for the room. They weren't, they were charged to my personal card. Parking at the hotel is extra, which I found unusual. When I asked about the rates, I understood that it was either a per exit fee or a flat rate. Since I was going to be there for a week I chose the flat rate. At checkout, I find that the "flat rate" is an exhorbitant DAILY rate, not a flat rate for the WEEK. Shocker. While I smoke and have stayed at many hotels in smoking rooms, my room did have a very noticeable stale smoke odor, something I've never experienced before. The shower curtain and the bedspread had stains on them, but otherwise the room was in average condition. Service was excellent, room was a little below average, parking was way below average, so overall nothing to brag about.

review.title: will to go back
review.reviewText: it's a great hotel and the room is very clean. it will be my 1st choice fo hotel to stay over night.

review.title: Its all good.
review.reviewText: Great for price, Food fine. Near airport. Nice people. Good bar. Nice Beds. 3rd floor still has smoking which is nice if you are a smoker. Listing doesnt show this so you need to ask.

review.title: Don't let this happen to you.
review.reviewText: I was returning from overseas after 5 and a half years of living in South Africa. I met the hotel clerk, told him my reservation was prepaid, everything was fine until he asked me for a credit card. I asked him why and he said he needed to authorize a charge on it which would be refunded to me in 2 weeks. I told him that was not possible. He then asked for cash. I said no, the room was already paid for. The manager stepped in. He said that now that I was in the United States I should expect to be asked for this sort of requirement at hotels. He said this is how we do things here. I have never been asked for a card before to authorize a deposit on a room that was already paid for in advance. The room itself was dingy--yellowing wall paper, dirty floors with stains, the outlets on the walls didn't fit the holes they were drilled into, the bathtub leaked, and the overall effect of the room was depressive, cheap and ugly. It was a shock for my first night back in the United States. I strongly encourage other travellers to avoid Crowne Plaza in Burlingame, save yourselves an unpleasant experience.

review.title: Feed Your Guests
review.reviewText: We arrived about 9.30pm, tired and hungry. We were told that the last place we could get food was the bar which closed at 10.00pm. We rushed to our room and back down to the bar and managed to get a sandwich which we ate as the staff began stacking chairs and cleaning up. Unbelievable for an airport hotel.

review.title: Too noisy!
review.reviewText: Chose this hotel as we had an early morning flight and it was close to the airport. The hotel is fairly new and contemporary and room was comfortable. However, because of its nearness to Highway 101, it was very noisy with the incessant sound of traffic. Not recommended for light sleepers!

review.title: Beware of Cranky Staff!!
review.reviewText: This hotel apparently likes to employ cranky old men as front desk staff. The room is nice and what I expected and the location is great in proximity to the airport. I think they need to review their customer service skills at a minimum if they keep preferring to hire old men to do the job.

review.title: So-So Stay
review.reviewText: GPS led us the wrong way, make sure to put in Burlingame address. Could hear highway from our fifth floor outside room. Beds not overly comfortable. Adequate service and amenities for the price. Very nice breakfast buffet, but pricey if you don't get it with your reservations. Overall, a decent stay.

review.title: Very good location, will go back again
review.reviewText: Conveniently located. Nice resturant and clean room.

review.title: Please Don't Stay Here
review.reviewText: After waiting 30 minutes for the airport shuttle about 3 rooms arrived together to check in. However, there was someone already checking in before us which took an unnecessary amount of time. Check in for us was also slow. The room was dirty (floors and bathroom looked like it wasn't touched). Since we were only staying at the hotel for a 4 hour nap we went right to bed. In the morning we missed our shuttle back to the airport by 1 minute. The woman at the counter was politely rude and stated "I'm sorry you read the shuttle list wrong". Why didn't she just tell us how stupid we were for listening to the person that checked us in the night before. She also didn't flinch when we let her know the room was dirty upon check-in. I've worked in the hotel business for 8 years and Crowne Plaza is horrible with customer service as well as cleanliness. Please don't stay here, there are plenty other hotels in the area to check out.

review.title: Best To Stay Before You Fly
review.reviewText: A great hotel to stay at before we flew out. Perfect for last minute travel.

review.title: Crowne Plaza Run By Amatuers
review.reviewText: First of all, parking gate was busted. Then they asked to pay $16 for overnight parking. We waited in line at the check-in while the reception argued with the customer ahead of us about why their children are not eligible for the complimentary continental breakfast. We were then sent to our room which would not unlock, and on having maintenance open the door for us, someone else's luggage was still in the room. There was no room service menu, and room service trays littered the hallways. The pool was dismal and tiny, hot-tub disgusting and only seated 4. The recent $20m renovation was a waste of money, veneers and wallpaper peeling off of every surface. This place is a dump disguised as something better. Next time we'd be better off at a motel 6.

review.title: Select a different hotel
review.reviewText: No comments

review.title: Crowne Review
review.reviewText: Good accommodations, the restaurant I only used it for breakfast and it was ok. I could suggest to get a bigger fitness facilities, too small, and one day was crowded. Another thing are the room Windows and frames, the chill gets into the room easily, but they have heating system.

review.title: I will be trying other hotels in the area to find a better fit.
review.reviewText: Not impressed.

review.title: You get what you pay for...
review.reviewText: Price was great but windows were very thin and therefore freeway noise was loud.

review.title: Inexpensive room, but tiny.. and great staff
review.reviewText: The overall hotel condition is somewhat old and dated. Inside the room there was very little floor space.. of course that's because there was a desk for work and a large, comfy bed. All of the hotel staff I talked with were very friendly and attentive, as good as any hotel around. I stayed because it was less expensive choice near SFO, and really all I ever need is a clean room, big comfortable bed, good TV, and Internet and I'm happy. My one suggestion to the hotel would be to offer internet free to make up for the dated, used feel of the place. The added expense of internet made it nearly the same as newer choices. They run a free shuttle right to the BART station at SFO, so going downtown is very convenient. Stay here if you want to be near the airport and at a decent place, don't really need internet, and need to save whatever you can on the cost.

review.title: Super SFO hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent value in solid traveler's hotel.

review.title: Hotel is in need of repair and restaurant was not open on Sunday night
review.reviewText: 2nd time we stayed in this hotel and will never go back. The restaurant was closed the Sunday after Thanksgiving and we could not get anything to eat from room service at 9PM. Used soap in the shower and very noisy

review.title: very convenient
review.reviewText: This hotel is very conveniently located with a free 5 minute shuttle service to SFO. Personnel is friendly and professional. From SFO BART goes quickly to downtown San Francico. No need to rent a car or use Taxis or stay at expensive downtown hotels. Row of good restaurants is in walking distance.

review.title: A good 3 1/2 star hotel
review.reviewText: Although I felt the lobby area could be decorated to be more welcoming and warm, it was ok. This is a 3 1/2 star hotel so I was not expecting a 4 or 5 star and I did not get that. The club class delux room could have been a bit larger. However all the amenities were there, and overall it was comfortable, especially for 3 days' stay. It is close to the airport and very convenient. I do believe that the offering for breakfast could be more variety.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: It was quiet, comfortable and close to the airport. I met with several friends and we were able to visit in the public areas without being disturbed. The cafe and bar offered meals at reasonable prices. This hotel is less than 2 miles from the airport and the ran every 20 minutes. It is a distance to the city's tourist attractions by public transportation but easy access to the highway if you are driving. I didn't have an opportunity to explore the immediate neighborhood but as a woman traveling alone, I felt safe and secure.

review.title: It is O.K. to go back.
review.reviewText: Not very clean. Very noisy b/c it is next to an expressway. On a good note, they moved me to a more quiet room, breakfast wast good, and Gym was good.

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: its good, clean, but the internet service not included in a price in the room, only in the lobby is free. the public transportation is too expensive for take the bart system

review.title: Lacking..
review.reviewText: I have frequented other Crowne Plaza hotels and this one was not up to par. My room carpet was dirty with spots, I was in a room overlooking the garbage, which was not pleasant,Service was ok, but not 'on point' with their professionalism. Lighting in bathroom was dark, and could not be corrected. windows were dirty. It was just extremely average..and I did not enjoy it at all

review.title: enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: I found the room to be very clean. i do like the fact that my request not to have the sheets changed daily, and the towels i used changed daily was observed. some other hotels i have been say they will follow as such, but they go ahead and do complete change on a daily basis. the front office staff were also very proffesional and kind.

review.title: goog
review.reviewText: good room service

review.title: Extremely Helpful
review.reviewText: Great food within walking besides the fine dinning within the hotel

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: dissapointed

review.title: A Very Good Business Hotel Option near SFO
review.reviewText: I've stayed here a bunch of times (and at other hotels in the area), and this particular Crowne Plaza is a totally solid option if you need a hotel near SFO for whatever reason on business-- reasaonable room rates, very professional, courteous staff, comfortable rooms, really good hotel overall.

review.title: Overall I was satisfied but have a few suggestions
review.reviewText: This is more of a business hotel so there isn't much within walking distance so a car is needed so be prepared to spend the $16 per day parking fee. It is VERY EXPENSIVE to take the BART from the airport into SF because they charge $4 extra each way because you are taking it from the airport. If you can get to a different BART station it will cost you less. It was $16+ round trip to go to Fisherman's Wharf and back then I had to wait for the hotel shuttle at the airport. Expensive and not convenient. The hotel staff were very nice, the room was comfortable and clean.

review.title: Pleasant, Clean, Convenient, Not too expensive
review.reviewText: All rounder.

review.title: beware of parking
review.reviewText: very nice hotel. really enjoyed the stay and its right next door to a really nice park for walking in the morning and is located in walking distance of a viewpoint for the airport where you can watch the planes take off and land. however, when i checked in, i was informed that there would be a parking fee of $16 per day to park my car at the hotel. parking was not even patrolled by security, and i had no idea i would incur this extra fee. shouldnt parking be free for a hotel guest??

review.title: cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: was one of the best ones ive stay at by far !!!!

review.title: Hotels need to specify you will charge Parking Fees
review.reviewText: The hotel is great. Really modern look. But before you booked your hotel call them As them about parking Fees. This hotel charges $16 per day.

review.title: Impressed how near the airport it was located.
review.reviewText: I was not happy about the parking fee, but I was impressed of the location for getting to the airport. The room was decorately nicely. I would return to it if I visit San Francisco again. Thanks.

review.title: Great Hotel !
review.reviewText: Beautiful rooms and easy access to the airport. Excellent customer service with big hospitality.

review.title: this is where we usually stay before flying out
review.reviewText: Needs to be up dated!

review.title: So-so hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is convenient to airport. Although the hotel's exterior appears to be fairly new, the carpeting inside the room looks worn and stained. The ambience does not convey freshness and comfort. Hotel staff could be friendlier. Hotel appears to be suitable more for business rather than family leisure.

review.title: somewhat dated
review.reviewText: Friendly, excellent service for a somewhat dated hotel.

review.title: Very nice hotel, reasonably priced, good location for airport
review.reviewText: Got in late and had to leave early! But it was a delightful short stay. The restaurant there was delish. The room was very comfy and very clean. No airport noise in my room!!

review.title: Crowne Plaza San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: The hotel is very convenient to freeways and the airport, and you can hear both constantly. The front desk was easily overwhelmed by problems, such as when the key card system broke down and the bellman had to open room doors for guests. It is still a good chice for visiting the San Francisco peninsula for a very reasonable rate.

review.title: Good Hotel if you need to stay close to the airport
review.reviewText: I liked this hotel very much. It was clean and service was good. The only problem is that you have to pay extra for parking. They have a free shuttle service to Burlingame and the airport. Would recommend to stay if you to need to be close to the airport. Ask for a room not facing the freeway..

review.title: Comfy for my one night stay!
review.reviewText: Room Service food was delicious! And friendly staff!
